title: Credit Repair Dispute Specialist
description:
Swipes Enterprises



A little bit about us,



We have been in the industry for more than 2 years now and have seen a lot of changes going on with the disputing strategies and methods to fix our clients credit score the best way and as safety as possible. And I mean ALL of it. For someone coming to work with Swipes Enterprises they are entering an already existing framework that they can get started with. No need to help business owners or staff to get them up to speed. Continuing on 2026 we are looking to strength our dispute process and coach some A++ players on our team to create an amazing environment that will change lives this year. We are highly motivated to give our clients the #1 investment for this year, which is a health credit score. So if you see yourself as someone who can take on a leadership role and work well with others, this will be a great opportunity for you. 



(1 Stop available only)



Position Overview

We are seeking a highly detail-oriented and compliance-driven Credit Repair Dispute Specialist to manage client credit file audits, dispute processing, and regulatory-compliant communications.



This role requires advanced knowledge of consumer credit laws, regulatory bodies, and structured dispute strategy. The ideal candidate is organized, fast, accurate, and capable of handling sensitive financial information with absolute precision.



This is not entry-level. We are looking for professionals who understand the seriousness of consumer credit compliance and documentation accuracy.



Core Responsibilities



Able to read full credit reports from (Experian, Equifax, TransUnion)



Identify reporting inaccuracies



Draft and process dispute letters aligned with FCRA standards



Track dispute timelines and bureau responses (A BIG ONE HERE AT SWIPES)



Maintain organized client files



Ensure 100?curacy of personal identifiers and sensitive information



Monitor escalations and regulatory complaint workflows



Manage multiple client cases simultaneously without errors



Regulatory & Industry Knowledge Required



Candidates must demonstrate some knowledge of:



Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA)



Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA)



Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB)



Federal Trade Commission (FTC)



Better Business Bureau (BBB)



State Attorney General complaint processes



Credit bureau reinvestigation procedures



Compliance-based dispute strategies (not template)



MORE SO GOOD TACTICAL SKILLS 



Required Skills & Traits



Extremely detail-oriented (double-checks all work before submission)

-Organized with structured workflow systems

-Ability to multitask across multiple active files

-Fast turnaround time without sacrificing accuracy

-Strong written communication skills



High level of discretion with sensitive client information



Comfortable working within SOPs and compliance guidelines



Self-managed and deadline-driven



Performance Expectations



Zero tolerance for data errors



Timely dispute cycle management



Proper documentation of every action taken



Clean, audit-ready file organization



Professional communication internally and externally



Ideal Candidate Profile



Prior experience in credit repair or financial services



Strong understanding of bureau dispute cycles



Experience handling CFPB or regulatory complaints



Familiar with CRM systems and digital file organization



Operates with precision under pressure. Looking forward to speaking with you.

title: SDR (COSMETIC INJECTABLES TRAINING PROGRAM) USA/CANADA
description:
****NOTE PLEASE READ*******

 If you do not have experience working with a Medical Clinic or working directly with Nurses, this may not be the role for you. There is a SIGNIFICANT amount of knowledge to retain in regards to Cosmetic Injectables and having experience in the space will set you apart aggressively from any other candidates! 

***************************



Sales Development Representative (Healthcare / Aesthetic Medicine)



DM Setting + Outbound Calls | Growth to Discovery Closer | Long-Term Role



We are the International Institute of Aesthetic Medicine (IIAM) — a leading North American training institute that certifies medical professionals in cosmetic injectables (Botox, dermal fillers, PRP, advanced aesthetic treatments).



We train physicians, nurse practitioners, physician assistants, and nurses who want to enter or grow in aesthetic medicine.



We are looking for a high-level SDR who can:



• Set appointments via Instagram &
 

• Make outbound calls to warm leads

• Pre-qualify healthcare professionals

• Eventually grow into running discovery calls



This is a long-term opportunity with serious growth potential.



Who This Role Is For



You are:



• Extremely fluent in English (neutral accent — must sound North American)

• Confident speaking to doctors and nurses

• Familiar with aesthetic medicine / cosmetic injectables

• Comfortable with outbound dials (not afraid of the phone)

• Highly organized and coachable

• Interested in long-term growth into a closing role



HUGE Bonus If You:



• Have worked in cosmetic injectables, dermatology, or med spa space

• Are a Registered Nurse (RN), medical professional, or have injector experience

• Have experience booking high-ticket appointments

• Have worked in HubSpot, Salesmsg, or CRM systems

• Understand Botox, dermal fillers, PRP, cannula techniques, etc.



We do not want someone who has to Google what Botox is.



Your Responsibilities



• Respond to inbound leads via DM and text

• Call new leads within 24 hours

• Pre-qualify medical professionals

• Book discovery calls for our Program Advisor

• Handle light objections (price, travel, timing)

• Follow structured SOP + scripts

• Log all activity inside HubSpot



After 3–6 months (based on performance), you may begin taking discovery calls and earning commission on closed sales.



Who We Train (Important Context)



We only accept licensed healthcare professionals:



• MD / DO

• NP / PA

• RN / RPN / LPN (varies by state/province)

• Dentists

• IMG physicians



You will be speaking to educated, career-driven medical professionals.



What Makes IIAM Different (So You Understand What You’re Selling)



• Hybrid training (online + hands-on on real patients)

• 3–4 students per instructor (very hands-on)

• Accredited in USA & Canada

• Connected to MedSpa Partners (40+ clinics in North America)

• Medical Director Matching Program

• Business & clinic launch support

• 0% financing options available



Our flagship program is the 2-Day Foundations of Aesthetic Medicine (Botox + Filler training). Most leads inquire about this.



Programs range from $3,000–$10,000+.



Compensation



Base salary + performance bonuses



Performance incentives for:

• Calls booked

• Show rate

• Enrollment rate (if you grow into closer role)



This is not a short-term VA position. We are building a serious sales team.



Work Schedule



Must overlap with:

• Eastern Time (USA/Canada)

• Some evenings possible



Full-time preferred.



How to Apply (IMPORTANT)



Send us:



A short Loom video (2–3 minutes) explaining:



Your experience in sales



Your experience in healthcare/aesthetics (if any)



Why you would be a good fit for this role



A voice recording sample (so we can hear your accent)



Your resume



In your application, include the word “Injector” so we know you read this fully.



Final Note



This role is for someone confident, intelligent, and hungry to grow.



If you want a long-term career in high-ticket healthcare sales and possibly move into a closer role — this is for you.



If you’re looking for a basic VA job, this is not it.

title: Remote Junk Removal Sales Representative
description:
PrimeHaul Junk Removal – Phoenix, AZ



Company Overview



PrimeHaul Junk Removal is a professional, modern junk removal company serving Phoenix, Arizona and the surrounding area. We specialize in high-quality single-item and multi-item junk removal, including furniture, appliances, TVs, shelving, and similar household items.



Our business is built around speed, transparency, and customer satisfaction. We operate a fully remote sales and dispatch model, partnering with independent subcontractors and established junk removal companies to deliver reliable service at scale. This is a long-term operation with plans to expand into additional cities.



?



Job Summary



We are hiring our first full-time Remote Sales Representative / Dispatcher to manage inbound leads, book junk removal jobs, dispatch subcontractors, and oversee jobs from start to finish.



This role combines sales, customer service, and operations. You will be responsible for converting inbound leads into booked jobs, managing fulfillment through Zenbooker, and handling customer issues with professionalism and accountability.



This position is ideal for someone with prior experience in remote sales or dispatching for a blue-collar or home-service business who wants a stable, long-term role with growth opportunity.



?



Key Responsibilities



Sales & Booking

 • Answer inbound phone calls via OpenPhone

 • Respond quickly to inbound leads from booking platforms and online inquiries

 • Book and close junk removal jobs using Zenbooker

 • Clearly explain flat-rate pricing and volume discounts

 • Focus on fast response times, quality bookings, and closing jobs

 • Apply discounts, waive fees, or issue credits when appropriate to close deals or resolve issues



Dispatch & Job Management

 • Manage all jobs inside Zenbooker

 • Dispatch subcontractors using Zenbooker’s auto-assignment and prioritization system

 • Ensure subcontractors receive accurate job details and accept assignments

 • Monitor job progress from booking through completion

 • Communicate with contractors and customers as needed on job day



Customer Service & Issue Resolution

 • Handle cancellations, reschedules, refunds, complaints, and price changes

 • Manage customer concerns professionally and empathetically

 • Follow SOPs to resolve most issues independently

 • Take ownership when mistakes happen and make it right for the customer

 • Escalate only extreme or unsolvable situations



Admin & Systems

 • Maintain accurate records in Google Sheets, Docs, and Drive

 • Follow SOPs, scripts, and workflows consistently

 • Track activity, bookings, and performance metrics

 • Work within Zenbooker as the primary operating system



?



How Our Process Works

 • Customers either book and pay online or call in to book

 • Payment is authorized at booking but not charged until the job is completed

 • Jobs appear in Zenbooker and are offered to subcontractors by location

 • Contractors accept, complete the job, and mark it complete

 • Admin charges the card and an automatic review request
 is sent



You will manage this process end-to-end.



?



Qualifications

 • Prior experience in remote sales, dispatching, or customer service for a home-service or blue-collar business (junk removal, cleaning, moving, etc.)

 • Strong phone communication and sales ability

 • Fast learner who follows SOPs closely

 • Organized, reliable, and detail-oriented

 • Comfortable handling customer issues independently

 • Experience with Zenbooker, Jobber, BookingKoala, Workiz, or similar platforms preferred

 • Comfortable using Google Docs, Sheets, and Drive

 • Able to work consistently during Arizona business hours



?



Training & Ramp-Up

 • Structured onboarding with shadowing

 • Recorded SOPs and walkthroughs

 • Live training and support

 • Expected ramp-up time: 1 week



?



Growth Opportunity



This is a long-term role with significant upside.



As we expand into additional cities:

 • You will help train new hires

 • You can move into a lead dispatcher or operations role

 • Compensation and responsibility will increase with performance



If you help us book more jobs and run operations smoothly, you will be rewarded.



?



How to Apply



Please include:

 • Start it with "JUNK!" To Show You Read This All

 • A short introduction

 • Your experience in remote sales or dispatching

 • Any experience with junk removal or home-service businesses

 • Your Resume

title: Intake Coordinator
description:
The Client Intake Specialist is the critical "first impression" for prospective clients and plays a vital role in the firm's growth by managing and tracking all potential new clients (PNCs). This role is responsible for ensuring a seamless, compassionate, and efficient process from the initial contact through client retention and scheduling the first consultation. This position requires exceptional organizational skills, attention to detail, and a high level of empathy and professionalism.



Key Responsibilities



Lead Management & Tracking:



Serve as the primary point of contact for all incoming leads (phone,
, web forms, walk-ins).

Rigorously track every lead in the firm’s CRM/case management software (e.g., Clio, MyCase) from inquiry to final disposition.

Ensure all data fields related to the lead source, contact information, and case details are accurate and up-to-date.



Client Screening & Vetting:



Conduct initial screening interviews with PNCs to gather necessary factual information about their legal matter.

Determine if the prospective matter aligns with the firm’s practice areas and current capacity.

Perform conflict checks immediately upon intake and document the results.



Communication & Nurturing:



Manage follow-up campaigns 
, phone calls, text messages) to nurture warm leads that have not yet scheduled a consultation.

Clearly and professionally communicate the firm’s scope of services, consultation fees, and required next steps.

Maintain documentation of all communications in the client file.



Scheduling & Conversion:



Efficiently schedule consultations and appointments for attorneys and paralegals.

Prepare and send intake packets, necessary forms, and engagement agreements to prospective clients.

Achieve firm conversion rate goals by consistently following up and moving qualified leads through the pipeline.



Reporting & Analysis:



Generate regular reports on lead volume, lead sources, conversion rates, and pipeline status for firm management.

Identify trends and bottlenecks in the intake process and recommend improvements.



Qualifications

Experience: 2+ years of experience in client intake, sales, customer service, or administrative support, preferably within a law firm or professional services environment.

Technical Skills: Proficiency with CRM or case management software (e.g., Salesforce, Clio, MyCase) and Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel). Experience working with data management spreadsheets is a strong plus.



Soft Skills:



Exceptional phone etiquette and professional communication skills (written and verbal).

High degree of empathy and the ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion.

Highly organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously.

Strong self-starter who can work independently and as part of a team.

title: Outbound Enrollment Closer – Career Certification Programs (Remote, EST)
description:
Outbound Enrollment Closer – Career Certification Programs (Remote, EST)



This is not customer service.

This is not inbound order-taking.



This is a phone-driven, outbound enrollment closer role for professionals who know how to control a consult, qualify fast, overcome objections, and close.



We are a U.S.-based online career school enrolling students into IT and Project Management certification programs (CompTIA, PMP, and related tracks). We provide warm leads. You bring the discipline, urgency, and closing skill.



What You’ll Be Doing (Daily Reality)



Make high-volume outbound calls to prospective students



Run structured, consultative enrollment calls (needs analysis ? recommendation ? close)



Control the call, set next steps, and ask for the enrollment



Handle objections around price, time, confidence, and urgency



Follow up relentlessly until the prospect converts or disqualifies



Log activity and outcomes accurately in CRM



Hit daily activity targets and monthly enrollment goals



Improve close rates through coaching, scripts, and call reviews



If you don’t like calling, this role will break you.



Who This Role Is For



Proven outbound / inside sales closers



Comfortable dialing daily and living on the phone



Strong command of English with clear U.S. cultural fluency



Confident asking direct questions and pushing for decisions



Competitive, coachable, metrics-driven



Organized and accountable without supervision



Experience selling education, training, coaching, or professional services is a major plus



Familiarity with certifications (CompTIA, PMP) helps—but closing ability matters more



Bachelor’s degree required



Who Should NOT Apply



Anyone who needs inbound-only leads



Anyone uncomfortable asking for money



Anyone who avoids objection handling



Anyone who wants a “soft” admissions role



Anyone who disappears when targets tighten



Schedule



Monday–Friday



10:00 AM – 6:30 PM EST



Compensation



Base pay: $1,200–$1,600 USD per month



Performance-based advancement and leadership path



Long-term role with stability and growth for performers



(Top performers move fast. Average performers don’t last.)



What You Get



Warm leads with real intent



Clear scripts, frameworks, and coaching



No gimmicks, no fake promises—just real programs that work



A sales culture that rewards results



Bottom Line



If you can:



Control a sales conversation



Build urgency without lying



Close consistently



Take coaching and improve



You will win here.



If not—this role will expose you quickly.

title: Google Ads Specialist
description:

Work-from-Home | U.S.-Based Google Advertising Agency

etings

Apply Today, We  Hire Fast!

title: Paid Media Performance Strategist
description:
About Brand Bros Co.



Brand Bros Co. is a full-service Branding, Marketing, and Public Relations agency built on strategy, creativity, and measurable execution. We partner with growth-focused businesses to build brands people recognize, trust, and choose — through integrated brand development, paid media, and strategic communications.



We are not looking for a junior ads manager.



We are hiring a highly experienced Paid Media Performance Strategist who can take full ownership of paid advertising performance across multiple client accounts — with zero training required.



Role Overview

This role is responsible for planning, executing, optimizing, and scaling paid digital campaigns across Google and Meta platforms, while strategically integrating
 marketing to support full-funnel performance.



You will own:

- Performance strategy

- Budget allocation

- Tracking implementation

- Conversion optimization

- Reporting & insights

-
 marketing integration

- Client communication



This is a high-trust, high-accountability role. You must be confident operating independently and making strategic decisions without oversight. If you require hand-holding or ongoing training, this is not the right fit.



Paid Media Strategy & Execution:

- Plan, launch, and manage campaigns across:

- Google Ads (Search, Display, YouTube)

- Google Local Service Ads

- Meta Ads 
 & Instagram)

- Strong preference for candidates with experience in:

- LinkedIn Ads

- OTT platforms

- Geofencing

- Multi-location campaigns

- You must have independently managed live budgets and made optimization decisions based on performance data — not theory.



Performance & Revenue Accountability

You are not managing ads. You are managing results. You will be responsible for:

- Cost per lead (CPL)

- Return on ad spend (ROAS)

- Conversion rate optimization

- Lead quality improvement

- Scaling winning campaigns

- You must be able to identify underperformance and implement corrective strategy quickly and independently.



Advanced Tracking & Attribution

You must be fully comfortable implementing and managing:

- Google Analytics 4

- Google Tag Manager

- Meta Pixel & Conversion API (CAPI)

- Enhanced Conversions (Google)

- UTM tracking structures

- Offline conversion imports

- CRM attribution workflows

- Retargeting strategy implementation

- Experience with call tracking platforms (ex: CallRail) is a plus.

- If you do not understand attribution, conversion tracking, and data accuracy, this role is not a fit.



 Marketing Integration (Mailchimp or Similar Platforms)

You will strategically integrate
 marketing into paid media funnels to improve conversion rates and lifetime value.

Responsibilities may include:

- Building and managing campaigns in Mailchimp (or similar platforms)

- Developing nurture and remarketing sequences aligned with paid campaigns

- List segmentation and audience targeting strategy

- Performance tracking and optimization of
 campaigns

- Supporting automated workflows that connect paid ads and CRM systems

-
 marketing in this role is performance-driven — not administrative.



Automation & Systems

You will build and manage automation systems using:

- Zapier

- CRM integrations

- Lead routing workflows

- Reporting automations

- We are building scalable systems. You must think in terms of process and efficiency.



Landing Pages & Conversion Optimization

Strong understanding of:

- Landing page strategy

- Offer positioning

- Creative testing

- Funnel optimization

- A/B testing frameworks

- Ads are only part of the equation. You must understand the full conversion funnel.



Creative Development

You must be capable of:

- Designing static ad creative independently

- Developing high-converting copy angles

- Testing hooks and messaging variations

- Creating simple motion assets (preferred)

- You do not need to be a designer — but you must be competent enough to execute without waiting on others.



Client Communication

This is a client-facing role. You must be able to:

- Explain performance clearly

- Communicate insights confidently

- Make strategic recommendations

- Defend decisions with data

- Strong written and spoken English is mandatory.



Non-Negotiable Requirements

- 4+ years managing paid digital campaigns independently

-Proven experience managing monthly budgets of $5,000+ USD per account

- Advanced proficiency in Google Ads, Google Local Service Ads, and Meta Ads

- Hands-on experience with GA4 and GTM

- Experience implementing tracking pixels and retargeting strategies

- Experience using Zapier for workflow automation

- Experience managing performance-driven
 campaigns (Mailchimp or similar)

- Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving ability

- Fully fluent English communication skills****

- Reliable high-speed internet



Availability

Must be available 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM EST Monday, Wednesday, and Friday. Additional flexibility outside those hours is a plus.



Compensation

This is a remote position based in the Philippines. Compensation will be very competitive based on experience and skill level. Performance-based incentives will absolutely be offered for strong results.



How to Apply

: 



Include:

title: Motion Designer (Dan Koe/Minimalist Animation Style)
description:
We are looking for a creative and disciplined Motion Designer to transform complex ideas into visually stunning, minimalist animated reels. The goal is to produce content that mirrors the "Dan Koe" aesthetic: clean lines, purposeful movement, grit textures, and a focus on high-level concepts (business, mindset, and productivity).



What You’ll Be Doing:



Creating animated reels from provided scripts/voiceovers.

Designing minimalist vector assets and typography that align with a "dark mode" or high-contrast aesthetic.

Implementing smooth transitions and "snappy" animations that keep viewers engaged.

Adding sound design and subtle textures to give the animations a premium, "paper-like" or hand-drawn feel.



Requirements:



Proven Experience: You must have a portfolio or reel specifically showing the Dan Koe style 

Technical Skill: Proficiency in Adobe After Effects (required) and Illustrator. Experience with plug-ins like Motion 4 or similar workflow tools is a plus.

Aesthetic Eye: Understanding of negative space, pacing, and how to use "pop-on" text for maximum impact.

English Proficiency: High level of written English to ensure there are no typos in the animated text.



Reliability: Ability to meet deadlines and communicate clearly on progress.



Why Join Us?



Consistent, long-term work for the right candidate.

Competitive salary based on experience and output.

Creative freedom within the established brand aesthetic.



How to Apply:



Please include the following in your application:

Portfolio Link: Specifically highlight any "Dan Koe style" or minimalist animation work.

Tools: What software and hardware do you use?

Availability: How many hours per week can you dedicate to this role?



Note: Applications without a portfolio or specific examples of minimalist motion design will not be considered.

title: Senior Virtual Assistant – Lead Response & Client Support (Full-Time)
description:
Company: The Grand UpperRoom

Location: Remote (Philippines-based)

Industry: Event Venue / Client Services



About Us

The Grand UpperRoom is a growing event venue business based in Texas, USA. We operate with established systems, scripts, and automation and are seeking an experienced Virtual Assistant who can execute consistently, follow workflows accurately, and ensure no lead or client inquiry is missed.

This role is not entry-level. We are looking for someone who can work independently within defined processes and does not require frequent reminders or supervision.



Role Overview

You will manage inbound client communication, review and follow up on leads, coordinate appointments and tours, and support the processing of booked clients through our internal systems. Success in this role depends on timeliness, organization, follow-through, and attention to detail, not creative writing.



Key Responsibilities

• Monitor and manage inbound communication across phone, SMS,
, and integrated inboxes, ensuring all inquiries are acknowledged promptly

• Review new and existing leads daily and take appropriate follow-up actions according to established workflows and priorities

• Schedule, confirm, and coordinate phone consultations and venue tours, including reminders, updates, and follow-ups

• Maintain accurate and organized records of all client interactions, outcomes, and next steps within the CRM

• Collect and verify essential client details (event type, date/date range, guest count, contact information) during initial interactions

• Process booked clients within internal systems, including preparing proposals, invoices, and related communications using approved templates and workflows

• Support client communication following proposals and invoices, including sending follow-up
s and texts using approved snippets and automations

• Respond to messages across multiple platforms (Google, social media, online directories, etc.) while balancing calls and scheduled tasks

• Identify and escalate sensitive or out-of-scope matters (refunds, cancellations, payment or contract concerns, complaints, unclear requests) to management using proper channels

• Conduct virtual venue tours when assigned (training and camera access provided) to support lead qualification and booking decisions

• Support general administrative tasks related to client communication, scheduling, and internal coordination as needed



Systems & Tools

• We use CRM and booking platforms such as GoHighLevel, Dubsado, Eventective, and Peerspace

• GoHighLevel is used primarily for customer communication and booking workflows

• Dubsado is used for proposals, contracts, invoicing, and client records

• Eventective and Peerspace are used mainly for lead capture and initial conversations

• Training will be provided; experience with similar CRM or client management platforms is highly transferable



Requirements

• Fluent in written and spoken English with a professional, client-friendly tone

• Comfortable communicating with North American clients via phone, text, and

• Spanish proficiency is a plus but not required

o Spanish-speaking inquiries may occasionally be supported using scripts, templates, or tools such as Google Translate

o Native or conversational Spanish fluency is not required

• Minimum 2 years of experience as a Virtual Assistant, Administrative VA, or Client Support VA

• Comfortable handling phone calls, follow-ups, appointment coordination, and client processing tasks

• Highly organized, detail-oriented, and reliable with deadlines and follow-through

• Proficient in working with multiple CRMs and able to quickly learn a new CRM

• Confident using Google Workspace (Gmail, Docs, Sheets, Calendar)

• Able to follow scripts, templates, and processes exactly as provided

• Stable internet connection and quiet work environment

This role is not suitable for candidates who:

• Need constant direction or reminders

• Prefer creative work over structured execution

• Avoid phone calls, documentation, or system-based tasks



Availability & Scheduling

• Coverage is required within a 14-hour window between 8:00 AM and 10:00 PM CST

• This role will follow an assigned shift within that window

• Includes scheduled rotational weekend coverage, with shifts assigned in advance

• Schedules are set ahead of time to ensure predictability and work-life balance



Work Schedule

• Full-time: 40 hours per week

• Fixed, assigned shift aligned with business needs

• Long-term position for the right candidate



Compensation

• $700 – $900 USD per month (?40,500 – ?52,000 PHP) full-time, based on experience and role alignment

• Paid bi-weekly on a regular schedule (final pay frequency discussed during hiring)

• Opportunities for performance-based bonuses tied to booking outcomes and overall contribution may be available after onboarding and probation



How to Apply

Please include:

1. Your resume

2. A short introduction summarizing your VA experience

3. Your years of experience and types of roles you’ve handled

4. Any CRM platforms or client management tools you’ve worked with

Important:

• When applying, please include “Process-Driven VA” in the subject line or first line of your application so we know you read the full job description.

• At the end of your application, briefly answer this question:

What is one thing you do to make sure no lead or client follow-up is missed?

Applications that do not follow these instructions may not be considered.

title: Amazon FBA Product Research VA (Online Arbitrage & Wholesale – Quality Focused) (BONUSES ON EVERY PURCAHSED PRODUCT))
description:
We are a UK-based Amazon FBA business looking for a reliable Product Research Virtual Assistant to help identify profitable products for Online Arbitrage and Wholesale sourcing.



This role focuses on QUALITY OVER QUANTITY. The objective is not to analyse the highest number of products, but to identify stable, profitable opportunities that meet clear and realistic buying criteria.



??????????????????



MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES



Scan supplier and wholesale product lists

Research products on Amazon UK

Analyse Keepa charts and price history

Calculate profit, ROI and competition levels

Identify stable and realistic buying opportunities

Record results accurately in Google Sheets



As the role develops, additional tasks may include researching potential suppliers and distributors and assisting with sourcing and supplier research.



This is a product research role only. No customer service, listing creation or advertising work is required.



??????????????????



REQUIREMENTS



Experience with Amazon FBA product research (Online Arbitrage or Wholesale)

Understanding of Keepa charts and Amazon fees

Strong attention to detail

Ability to prioritise accuracy over speed

Good English communication

Reliable internet connection



??????????????????



WORK STRUCTURE



Initial paid trial period (1 full day, 8 hours). In some cases a few trial days may be used to ensure a good long-term fit.

Trial rate: $2.00 per hour.

No bonus during the trial period.



After successful trial, the role moves to part-time and eventually full-time work.



We are looking for a long-term tea
mber. Pay for this role WILL increase over time as performance, reliability and results improve.



??????????????????



PAY STRUCTURE



Base pay is $2.00 per hour.



In addition, performance bonuses are paid for product leads that meet our buying criteria and are approved for purchase. The bonus structure rewards accuracy and quality rather than high volume.



Bonus structure example:



Approved product with approximately £100–£199 total expected profit ? $3 bonus

Approved product with approximately £200–£399 total expected profit ? $6 bonus

Approved product with approximately £400+ total expected profit ? $12 bonus



This structure encourages focusing on stronger opportunities rather than sending large numbers of low-quality leads.



This will include any wholesale excel sheets I provide (I will be sending quite a few of these to be scanned)



We prefer fewer high-quality leads instead of many low-quality submissions.



??????????????????



EXAMPLE BUYING CRITERIA (FOR GUIDANCE ONLY)



The following is an example of our current criteria. This is not final and we will discuss and agree on realistic criteria together once work begins.



Minimum ROI around 30%

Minimum profit around £3 per unit

Stable pricing history on Keepa

Reasonable competition levels

Products with strong overall profit potential



In general, if a product cannot comfortably generate approximately £100 total profit per purchase, it is usually not worth buying. Higher profit opportunities are more likely to be selected.



Final criteria will be discussed and refined together to ensure they are realistic and achievable.



??????????????????



WHEN APPLYING, PLEASE ANSWER THE FOLLOWING



How many years of experience do you have with Amazon FBA product research?

Which tools do you use for research (Keepa, SellerAmp, etc.)?

Find one real profitable product OA or Wholesale and explain in detail why it is a good pick (Doesn't have to be 100% ROI I am interested in your reasoning and explanation as to why it is good. Minimum 20% ROI)

On average, how many OA or Wholesale leads do you believe you can find in a full working day? (Please be honest — higher numbers do not mean better.)

What sourcing methods do you normally use (supplier lists, storefront research, reverse sourcing, manual sourcing, etc.)?

What criteria do you believe is most important when d
 if a product is a good buy?

Describe a situation where you d
 NOT to buy a product and why.



We value honest and realistic answers more than impressive numbers.



??????????????????



To confirm you have read the full job description, please include the word “Keepa” at the beginning of your application.

Virtual Assistant (Full-Time | 30–40 Hours/Week)

Extreme Ownership | Growth-Minded | Mission-Driven



Ready to Be More Than “Just a VA”?



At Felicia Reed Photography & Coaching, we empower women to step into bold confidence and self-worth through luxury photography, transformative coaching, and live events. We’re searching for a high-performing Virtual Assistant who wants to grow a career—not just work a job. If you thrive on ownership, crave systems, and want to make a real impact, we want to meet you!



Who We Want

You want to help build something bigger than yourself.

This is NOT for you if you:

Resist feedback or change.

Want a short-term, side gig, or “easy” work.

/webinar sequences.

Live Launch/Event Support

Capture launch metrics.



Tools You’ll Use or Master:

Canva, Notion, Loom, Zoom (moderator level), Podia, Flodesk, GoHighLevel, Showit, Google Workspace, Basic Photoshop





Traits We Value

What Success Looks Like

Team that treats you as a business partner

 with subject line:

, include:

.

title: Experienced Video Editor Needed (AI + Faceless Compilation Videos)
description:
We are looking for a skilled and reliable video editor to join our team on an ongoing basis. This role is ideal for someone experienced in both AI-generated videos and traditional faceless/compilation-style videos for YouTube.



**What You’ll Be Creating**

You will be editing videos across multiple niches, which may include:

AI-generated videos (voiceover, visuals, music, pacing)

Faceless compilation videos (stock footage, clips form other videos, sound effects, transitions)

Long-form and short-form YouTube content (depending on project)



** Pay Structure**

$10 USD/per Video for Simple AI-generated videos

More for complex AI videos or non-AI compilation videos

Pay is per video, based on complexity and scope.

Additional tasks beyond video creation will pay more. 



**Required Skills**

Strong video editing skills (Premiere Pro, After Effects, CapCut, or similar)

Experience creating faceless YouTube videos

Experience using AI tools for video creation

Good pacing, storytelling, and attention to detail

Ability to follow instructions and meet deadlines



**Nice-to-Have Skills (Not Required, But a Big Plus)**

Graphic design (thumbnails, simple graphics, text overlays)

Understanding of YouTube best practices and retention



Working knowledge of AI tools for:

Create Titles, Descriptions, Tags, Scripts



**What to Include in Your Application**

Your video portfolio (links required)

Any YouTube channels you’ve worked on or own (if available)



A brief explanation of:

Your experience with AI-generated videos

Your experience with faceless/compilation-style videos

Your primary editing software and AI tools you use



** Work Type **

Freelance / long-term opportunity

Consistent work for the right candidate

Clear instructions and expectations provided

If you are detail-oriented, creative, and comfortable working across different niches, we’d love to hear from you.



Please include the word "Monkey" in the subject line of your response. 



Multiple Hires

title: Property Maintenance & Compliance Coordinator (Remote - UK Real Estate)
description:
This role is operations-heavy and not suitable for entry-level virtual assistants.



We are a UK-based property management company looking for a full-time remote Maintenance Coordinator VA to manage day-to-day property operations.



You will be the central point of communication between tenants, contractors, and our internal team.



This is a long-term role for someone organised, proactive, and experienced in property management maintenance.



Responsibilities



- Coordinate maintenance requests from tenants

- Assign jobs to contractors and follow up until completion

- Track ongoing maintenance tasks

- Communicate with tenants regarding updates

- Review contractor invoices and match them to completed work

- Update records inside our CRM (Brevo)

- Ensure maintenance issues are resolved quickly and professionally



Requirements



- Experience in property management or maintenance coordination

- Excellent written and spoken English

- Strong organisational skills

- Comfortable managing multiple tasks at once

- Reliable internet and quiet workspace

- Able to work Monday–Saturday, 9am–6pm UK time

- Experience working with UK property companies

- Experience with CRMs (Brevo or similar)



Role Details



- Full-time remote position

- Long-term role

- Immediate start for the right candidate



Typical Day in This Role



- Contact customers via WhatsApp/email about upcoming property compliance checks

- Assign jobs to contractors based on location

- Track bookings and job progress

- Send contractors job details

- Upload completion documents into database

- Update job statuses for approval

- Coordinate quotes for additional work when issues arise

- Reconcile payments via Xero

- Send certificates to customers after completion



How to Apply (IMPORTANT)



To be considered, please follow ALL steps:



1. Record a 2-3 minute Loom video introducing yourself and your relevant experience

2. Describe any experience you have with property maintenance coordination

3. Send your loom video here



Applications that do not follow these steps will not be considered.

title: Recruiting Systems Specialist
description:
We are a fast-growing national financial services agency looking for a data-driven Recruiting Systems Specialist to build and scale our candidate acquisition engine across multiple job platforms.



This is not a basic VA role.



You will be responsible for sourcing candidates, managing job board listings (especially Indeed), optimizing performance metrics, and building automation workflows that increase booking rates and reduce no-shows.



If you think in systems, understand funnels, and track KPIs daily — this is for you.



What You’ll Be Responsible For

* Creating and optimizing job listings on Indeed and other platforms

* Managing sponsored job campaigns and budgets

* A/B testing job titles and descriptions

* Monitoring applicant flow daily

* Implementing speed-to-lead response systems

* Managing CRM follow-up automation (GoHighLevel or similar)

* Tracking and reporting:

- Cost per applicant

- Cost per interview

- Cost per hire

- Cost per RTW

* Refreshing and reposting listings strategically

* Identifying new traffic sources



???? Success Metrics

You will be measured on:



* Applicant volume

* Booking percentage

* Cost per qualified candidate

* Cost per RTW

* Funnel conversion improvements



This is a performance-driven role.



???? Qualifications

* Experience posting and managing jobs on Indeed (required)

* Familiar with job board optimization

* Experience with CRM platforms (Zoho, GHL, HubSpot, etc.)

* Strong understanding of recruiting funnels

* Data-driven mindset

* Excellent written communication

* Organized and proactive



Bonus:

* Experience in sales recruiting

* Experience managing sponsored job budgets

* Automation workflow building experience



???? Compensation

* $800–$1,500/month (based on experience)

* Performance bonus tied to cost-per-RTW targets

* Long-term opportunity for growth



???? How to Apply

Send:

1. Resume

2. A short video (2–3 minutes) explaining:



   * Your experience with Indeed

   * How you would increase applicant flow at low cost

   * How you would improve booking rates



Only applicants who follow instructions will be considered.

title: Full-Time GoHighLevel (GHL) Level 1 & 2 Support Agent - Client-Facing Technical Support
description:
We are seeking an experienced, full-time GoHighLevel (GHL) support specialist who excels at day-to-day client assistance — NOT complex workflow building or automation development.



You will be judged more on simple, practical support tasks — like helping a client trace what workflow a message came from in the Conversations tab — than on building advanced automations.



We already have builders. We need someone who lives in support tickets and understands how real clients use (and sometimes misuse) the platform every day.



You will receive training on our specific processes, tools, and clients, but not on the fundamentals of the GHL platform itself. You must already have strong, practical knowledge from real client-facing support experience on GHL.





Key Responsibilities:



- Provide Tier 1 & 2 support: troubleshooting workflows, triggers, tags, conversations, calendars, campaign optimization, and common user questions.

- Onboard new clients to GHL (account setup, snapshots, basic workflows).

- Guide non-technical clients through practical platform usage with patience and clear communication.



Required Experience & Skills:



- Proven client-facing GHL support experience (onboarding AND ongoing daily support tickets) — not just personal or agency building.

- Deep knowledge of everyday user issues: tracing messages to workflows, fixing conversation routing, tag failures, calendar sync problems, etc.

- Excellent English communication (written & spoken).

- Full-time availability with overlap in US time zones (Arizona/Phoenix preferred).



This is a 100% remote, full-time position (30+ hours/week).

Paid via PayPal/Payoneer or similar.



How to Apply:

To be considered, please apply with:



- Submit a short video introduction (1-2 minutes max, recorded via 
 or similar free tool — unlisted YouTube link also fine). 

- In your written application please include how many months/years you have in client-facing GHL support (exclude personal or internal agency building only).

- Approximate number of clients you have onboarded AND provided ongoing support to.

- 2–3 specific examples of practical support issues you've resolved (e.g., "Helped client trace an inbound message to the correct workflow using the Conversations tab" or similar real ticket examples).

- Your current time zone and daily availability for US overlap.

- Attach resume/portfolio if available.



Serious applicants with real GHL support experience only. Generic applications or those without the required examples will not be considered.



We will review applications and reach out via the platform for interviews.



Thank you!

Booking carriers and sending rate confirmations

Tracking and tracing shipments

Communicating with carriers regarding pickup and delivery

Handling issues such as delays or carrier problems

Researching companies and contacts

s to prospects

title: Sales Manager (flexible hours) English Fluent
description:

title: Own Your Results—Own Your Future
description:
(Cold Call Predator & Elite Closer | Real Base + Uncapped Pay | Full Autonomy & High Accountability)



Own Your Results—Own Your Future



Most companies talk about opportunity; we pay for it—every single month. Our best earners don’t chase quotas—they lap them. If you want a long-term sales seat (not a “gig”), extreme autonomy, and direct advancement based solely on metrics, read on. If not, keep scrolling.



Your Mission



100+ outbound calls per day to distressed property owners (tax defaults, inheritance, liens, etc.—you find the pain, you build rapport, you close)



Zero handoffs: You control the deal from initial outreach through close. No pass-offs, no excuses, no “support” teams to blame



Live in your numbers: You log every lead, every call, every stage—real-time, every day. Pipeline management is not optional.



Transparent scoreboard: Your results are public. You know exactly where you stand. Your pay and growth = your production. Period.



What We Provide



Real base (not a “draw”): You start with a guaranteed income while you stack your pipeline



No cap on commission: The only limit is your output. Top reps consistently double/triple their base—because they outperform



Everything but excuses: We deliver the tech, the data, and the process. You deliver the work ethic and skill



Clear promotion path: Prove yourself on the board, and you’re first in line for leadership roles, new territories, or team buildouts



Long-term security: We retain only top producers—those who meet or exceed daily/weekly metrics, quarter after quarter



Top Performers Are:



Obsessed with their own KPIs—love tracking, reporting, and improving



Comfortable with radical feedback, public rankings, and aggressive targets



Full-cycle closers who want a direct link between their actions and their earnings



Looking for a career seat—not a temp job, not “account management,” and never “just a lead generator”



Do NOT Apply If:



You dislike public, daily performance tracking



You need long ramp periods, constant encouragement, or handholding



You prefer “team closes,” handoffs, or a relaxed, untracked sales process



You don’t want to own the full sales cycle—start to finish



How to Apply – Two Steps Required (No Exceptions):



Resume: Must clearly show outbound calling and end-to-end closing experience. Include your personal best for daily calls & monthly closed deals.



2-Minute Unscripted Voice Memo:



State your name, country, and your record for calls in a single day



Break down your most challenging cold-to-close deal (real steps, negotiation tactics, outcome)



Share your daily tracking system for calls, leads, and pipeline



Explain why you want a career where your commission is tied directly to your scoreboard—not a relationship manager, not “just a job”



Applications missing either step, or not following these instructions, are auto-rejected.



Bottom Line:



This is a real seat for a real producer. Metrics, pay, and advancement are tied to your scoreboard—not your tenure, effort, or personality. Want in? Show us. If you want comfort, look elsewhere.

title: Real Estate Sales Closer & Team Lead (Remote) — Base + Commission + Team Override

Compensation

title: Instagram Engagement Assistant (Beauty / Nail Industry)
description:
This is not a basic “like and comment” job.

I’m looking for someone who understands how to build real connections on Instagram – someone who can help me grow my community by engaging with the right audience (nail technicians and educators) in a natural, authentic way.



I’m Magdalena, a beauty business coach helping nail technicians and nail educators attract clients (and students) via Instagram. I’m looking for a detail-oriented, kind, and proactive assistant who will organically engage with the right people on Instagram so they naturally discover and follow my account.



This is not a generic VA role. Your work directly influences who finds my profile and becomes a lead.



Your role will focus on Instagram engagement & outreach, which means:



-Finding nail techs and nail educators (mostly UK-based, but also English-speaking worldwide).

-Engaging with them: liking posts, writing thoughtful comments, and reacting to stories (no copy-paste spam).

-Sparking curiosity so they check out my profile and follow.

-Following a clear daily system, I’ll give you (hashtags, location searches, etc.).



This role is about quality engagement, not random likes. Every comment should sound human, personal, and friendly.



Must-haves:



-Excellent written English (friendly, natural, not robotic)

-Strong attention to detail & ability to follow frameworks

-Comfortable using Instagram + Google Sheets

-Reliable internet & ability to work independently

-Kind, respectful, warm tone of voice



Workload & Schedule:

1–2 hours per day (Monday–Saturday).

Engage with 20–30 new profiles daily.

Flexible hours, but daily consistency is key.



Salary & Growth:

Starting: $3–$4/hour (depending on experience).

Performance bonuses or raises after 3 months.

Long-term position if we’re a good fit.



How to Apply:

To show you’ve read this, please start your application with:

“Hi Magdalena, I’m your Instagram Assistant!”



Then tell me:



-Why you’d be a great fit for this role.

-Your experience with Instagram (personal or professional).

We provide sales training through our Flight School platform, coaching programs, and live events. We need an experienced, reliable VA to support operations, customer success, and sales.

/calendar management, scheduling, documentation, file organization

title: SEO Article Writer & Trend Researcher (3D Printing & Tech)
description:
We are a Canadian-based technology and e-commerce company operating multiple online brands in 3D printing, servers, and technical products. Our websites help customers research, compare, and buy specialized equipment and services.



We publish practical, search-driven content that answers real questions people are actively searching on Google, Reddit, and online communities.



We are looking for a writer who understands how people search online and can turn those searches into useful, high-quality articles and discussions.



Role Overview

Your primary role is to identify topics people are searching for and create helpful articles and supporting discussions around those topics.



You will research search trends using tools like AnswerThePublic, Google Trends, Reddit, and forums, then write SEO-focused content for our websites that answers those questions clearly and accurately.



You will also participate in relevant Reddit and forum discussions to help surface and reference our content in a natural way.



This is not spam or low-quality link building. The goal is authentic, helpful content and participation in real discussions.



Responsibilities

- Topic & Trend Research

- Find article ideas using AnswerThePublic, Google Trends, Reddit, forums, and search results

- Identify common questions, comparisons, and buying intent topics

- Propose content ideas based on real search demand

- SEO Article Writing

- Write clear, helpful articles based on researched topics

- Ensure articles match search intent and answer the user’s question

- Use AI tools to assist drafting when appropriate

- Edit and fact-check AI content for accuracy and readability

- Format content for WordPress or similar CMS



Community Participation

- Identify relevant Reddit threads and discussions

- Create genuine discussion posts when appropriate

- Participate in conversations naturally and helpfully

- Reference useful resources (including our content) where relevant

- Maintain multiple professional discussion accounts responsibly



Content Optimization

- Improve existing articles based on new trends

- Add FAQs and structured sections based on search data

- Help strengthen internal linking across our sites



Content Topics

You will write primarily about:

- 3D Printing

- 3D printers, filaments, materials, troubleshooting

- Comparisons, buying guides, how-to content

- Industry suppliers and services



Servers & Hosting

- Linux servers, Windows servers, VPS, dedicated hosting

- Performance, setup, comparisons, troubleshooting

- Infrastructure and technical guides



Other Technical Brands

- Manufacturing and technology products

- B2B suppliers and services

- Equipment and tools

 

Requirements

- Strong written English

- Experience writing SEO articles

- Ability to research topics independently

- Understanding of search intent and keyword targeting

- Comfortable using AI writing tools and editing outputs

- Familiar with Reddit and online forums

- Organized and detail-oriented



Nice to Have

- Experience in 3D printing or tech topics

- Basic understanding of SEO

- Experience with WordPress

- Experience researching buyer-intent keywords



How We Work

- We discuss brand guidelines and topic direction

- You propose article ideas based on search research

- Articles are reviewed and published by you

- Long-term role with consistent content needs

- Multiple brands and ongoing work available



To Apply

Please include:

- Links to SEO articles you wrote

- Your experience with research tools (AnswerThePublic, Trends, Reddit, etc.)

- Your process for finding article topics

- Your monthly rate or per-article rate or per hour

title: Video Ads Editor Long Form
description:
Video Editor (VSL & Direct-Response Ads) – Remote

Company Description



We are a fast-growing health-focused e-commerce brand operating primarily in the DACH market (Germany, Austria, Switzerland).

Our core product is a CE-certified medical back decompression device, sold via direct-response advertising (Meta,
, Instagram, YouTube).



We focus heavily on long-form VSLs, short-form ad creatives, and conversion-driven video content.



Role Description



This is a remote, contract-based position for a Video Editor with a strong focus on VSL editing and performance marketing creatives.



You will work closely with our marketing team and receive:



Fully written scripts



Clear creative direction



Examples of winning ads and VSLs



Your main responsibility is to turn scripts into emotionally engaging, high-converting video ads by:



Editing and structuring video content



Sourcing relevant stock footage or clips when needed



Creating AI-based content (UGC-style clips, avatars, or b-roll)



Syncing visuals tightly with script pacing and emotion



This role is execution-focused — strategy and scripts are provided.



Responsibilities



Edit 3–5 minute VSLs and shorter ad variations



Assemble videos using provided scripts and guidelines



Source or generate supporting visuals (stock, b-roll, AI tools)



Create direct-response style edits (hooks, pacing, clarity, emotion)



Occasionally create AI UGC-style content or short clips



Deliver clean, structured files ready for paid advertising



Required Qualifications



At least 1 year of video editing experience, preferably for social media or ads



Solid understanding of direct-response video structure



Strong English communication skills (at least B2/C1)



Proficiency with common editing tools (Premiere Pro, After Effects, CapCut, etc.)



Ability to follow instructions precisely and meet deadlines



Willingness to iterate and improve based on feedback



Nice to Have (Big Plus)

Familiarity with AI tools such as:



Veo 3



Sora 2



AI UGC/avatar generators



Basic understanding of performance marketing (hooks, retention, CTA timing)



Work Structure



Remote



Initial commitment: ~16 hours per week



Possibility to scale to full-time within 6–8 weeks



Flexible schedule, but fast turnaround and responsiveness are important



Personal Qualities We Value



Strong attention to detail



Ability to follow systems and instructions



Willingness to learn and adapt quickly



Reliability and clear communication



Long-term mindset (we prefer ongoing collaborations)



How to Apply (Important)



Please apply via the Google Form below (preferred).

We use this to ensure applicants can follow instructions.



Google Form Link:




/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSc_luFN0n8fbRNQ2QVoVlQsZXONKO-t7JE70yaZQkAsO_7VLQ/viewform?usp=dialog

title: Growth & Revenue Operator
description:
We are hiring a Growth & Revenue Operator to partner directly with the CEO in scaling a women’s health DTC CGP brand currently generating approximately $55K per month in revenue.



This is not a VA role.

This is a strategic execution role.



You will help bring structured growth thinking, disciplined execution, and revenue accountability to the business.



You are not expected to replace the CEO’s vision.

You are expected to help turn it into measurable results.



What You Will Own

• Build and maintain weekly revenue dashboards

• Track CAC, AOV, LTV, retention, and subscription metrics

• Identify bottlenecks and propose focused growth initiatives

• Structure and manage 90-day growth sprints

• Coordinate creative testing with paid media and content

• Optimize subscription and affiliate performance

• Build and document SOPs for all growth workflows



What We’re Looking For

• Strong understanding of DTC growth fundamentals

• Comfortable with Shopify analytics and subscription metrics

• Thinks in tradeoffs and prioritization

• Able to make data-backed recommendations

• Works US hours

• Proactive, organized, and disciplined

• Comfortable pushing back respectfully with logic



Experience with Klaviyo, subscription apps, funnel math, and project management tools is preferred.





What Success Looks Like in the First 90 Days

• A clear revenue dashboard built from scratch

• Weekly KPI reporting rhythm established

• A defined growth sprint in motion

• At least three structured experiments running

• All major growth processes documented





Application Process

Step 1: Video Submission

Record a 2 to 3 minute video answering:

“How would you approach scaling a $55K per month DTC brand to $100K per month within 3 months?”



Focus on prioritization, not volume of ideas.



Step 2: Sample Work

Submit one example of a dashboard or reporting framework you have built.



Step 3: 100-Day Growth Plan Exercise



Selected candidates will be asked to sign an NDA and receive limited brand data including:

• Current revenue

• AOV

•
 list size

• Subscription percentage

• Traffic sources

• Product mix



Based on this information, you will outline a focused 100-day growth plan including:

 1. Top 3 revenue priorities only

 2. Specific initiatives within each priority

 3. Weekly KPIs that would be tracked

 4. What you would stop or deprioritize

 5. Key risks and tradeoffs



This exercise is designed to evaluate strategic thinking, clarity, and prioritization.



We are not looking for 30 ideas.

We are looking for focus and revenue logic.

title: Video Editor – Short Form & Paid Creative
description:
We are hiring a skilled Video Editor to help drive content and paid creative for a fast-growing women’s health DTC brand.



This is not just an editing role.



This role exists to turn raw footage into scroll-stopping, conversion-focused content that supports growth across organic and paid channels.



You will work closely with the CEO and Growth Operator.





What You Will Create

• High-performing Reels and TikTok videos

• Paid ad creatives for Meta and TikTok

• YouTube Shorts

• Founder-led talking head edits

• Test variations of the same creative

• Long-form repurposing into short-form assets



You will help build a creative engine, not just edit clips.



What We Expect From You

• Strong understanding of short-form hook structure

• Ability to edit for retention and pacing

• Strong instincts around scroll behavior

• Understanding of direct-response creative principles

• Ability to test multiple angles from one raw video

• Organized file management and content library systems

• Comfortable working with performance feedback



You should be able to explain why an edit performs, not just how it looks.



You Will Also

• Build repeatable editing workflows

• Create branded templates

• Organize content by theme, offer, and campaign

• Document editing SOPs

• Collaborate with paid media to produce testing variations

• Help scale creative output without sacrificing quality





What Success Looks Like in 60–90 Days

• Consistent output of 3–5 short-form pieces per week

• Creative variations built intentionally for testing

• Improved retention metrics on short-form content

• Paid creative structured for performance, not aesthetics

• Organized creative library with clear labeling





Application Process



Step 1: Portfolio Submission

Submit at least 3 short-form examples. Include one that feels direct-response oriented.



Step 2: Why This Role Video

Record a 2–3 minute video explaining:

	1.	What makes short-form content convert?

	2.	How you think about retention and pacing

	3.	How you would approach editing for a founder-led brand





Step 3: Editing Test

We will provide raw footage.

You will:



• Create 1 organic version

• Create 1 paid-ad version

• Provide 2 alternate hooks



We are evaluating creative thinking, not just technical skill.

title: Fractional Paid Media Partner – DTC Growth
description:
We are seeking a fractional paid media partner to help scale a women’s health DTC brand currently generating approximately $55K per month in revenue.



This is not a campaign management role.



We are looking for a performance-driven partner who understands how to scale subscription-based DTC brands from $50K per month toward $200K+ per month with disciplined testing, creative leadership, and clear performance accountability.



You will work directly with the CEO and Growth Operator.



What This Role Is Responsible For

• Owning paid acquisition strategy across Meta, TikTok, google and other relevant channels

• Developing and managing a structured creative testing roadmap

• Providing weekly performance breakdowns with actionable insights

• Recommending budget allocation based on performance and blended CAC

• Setting CAC targets aligned with LTV and subscription economics

• Coordinating with internal creative and growth teams

• Documenting paid media SOPs for long-term scalability



This role is not about launching ads and reporting ROAS.

It is about building a repeatable acquisition engine.



What We Are Looking For

• Proven experience scaling DTC brands in the $50K to $200K+ per month range

• Strong understanding of subscription LTV and payback periods

• Creative-first mindset

• Experience running structured testing cycles

• Ability to communicate clearly in weekly reporting

• Comfort operating with data and making decisive recommendations



You must be able to explain not only what happened, but why it happened and what to do next.



What Success Looks Like in 90 Days

• Clear paid acquisition strategy aligned with revenue targets

• Creative testing framework in place

• Consistent weekly reporting cadence

• Defined CAC targets tied to LTV

• Predictable acquisition performance trends



Application Process



Step 1: Why This Role Video

Submit a 3 to 5 minute video answering:

 1. Why are you uniquely qualified to scale a subscription-based DTC brand at this stage?

 2. What mistakes do brands at $50K per month typically make in paid acquisition?

 3. What would you prioritize first in the first 60 days?



Step 2: Case Exercise

You will be provided with high-level metrics under NDA including:

• Current revenue

• AOV

• Subscription percentage

• Current ad spend

• Current blended CAC

• Top-performing products



Based on this information, provide:

• A 60-day paid acquisition roadmap

• CAC targets tied to LTV assumptions

• Budget allocation recommendation

• Creative testing plan

• Risks and tradeoffs



We are evaluating clarity, logic, and prioritization — not presentation design.

title: Senior U.S. Bankruptcy Paralegal (Remote)
description:
We are seeking an experienced Senior Bankruptcy Paralegal to join our growing team. This is a full-time remote position with long-term opportunity.



We handle Chapters 7, 13, and 11 cases and are looking for someone with real debtor-side experience who can independently prepare, review, and manage bankruptcy files from intake through confirmation or discharge.



This is not an entry-level role. Hands-on U.S. bankruptcy drafting experience is required.



About the Role



You will take ownership of assigned cases and ensure petitions, schedules, statements, and plans are accurate and complete before filing. You will work closely with attorneys and internal staff to keep cases moving efficiently.



Responsibilities



• Prepare and draft Chapter 7 and Chapter 13 petitions and schedules

• Assist with Chapter 11 filings when applicable

• Prepare Chapter 13 plans and amendments

• Review client financial documents for accuracy and consistency

• Calculate income, expenses, and disposable income

• Prepare amendments in response to trustee objections

• Monitor deadlines and case progress

• Maintain organized electronic case files



Who We’re Looking For



• 3+ years of U.S. debtor-side bankruptcy experience

• Strong experience with Chapters 7 and 13 (Chapter 11 a plus)

• Comfortable drafting schedules and statements independently

• Experience handling trustee objections and amendments

• Detail-oriented and highly organized

• Able to manage volume while maintaining accuracy

• Strong written communication skills



We are a structured, high-volume firm. We value precision, ownership, and reliability.



To Apply



Please include:



1. A summary of your U.S. bankruptcy experience

2. Which chapters you have worked on

3. The types of documents you have personally drafted

4. Your expected monthly compensation

5. Your availability



In your subject line, please write: SENIOR PARALEGAL



We are looking for professionals who take pride in accuracy and getting cases to the finish line.

title: Senior Video Editor – Performance Ad Creative (UGC & Paid Social)
description:
Salary: $1,000 – $1,200 USD per month

Hours: Full Time – 40 hours per week

Schedule: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM UK Time (Mon–Fri)



Overview



Stride Digital is a UK-based performance marketing agency working with established ecommerce brands.



We are hiring a Senior Video Editor with a sharp eye for detail and a strong understanding of paid social advertising.



This role is focused entirely on performance creative. Not cinematic editing, not YouTube vlogs, not long-form content.



Your work exists for one reason: to help us test creative rapidly, improve engagement, and support lower CPAs.



What you will be editing



• Short-form paid ads for Meta and paid social platforms

• UGC-style videos and creator content

• Multi-clip edits combining raw assets into cohesive ad narratives

• Variations of winning creatives (hooks, pacing, structure)

• Motion-enhanced ads using clean text overlays and graphics



This role prioritises clarity, pacing, and conversion psychology.



We are not looking for entertainment editing or visual effects showreels.



Working environment & workflow



Stride operates a structured creative system:



• Clear briefs delivered via Trello

• Daily communication via Slack

• Precise, time-stamped feedback using 



No vague revision requests. No scattered feedback.



You will always know exactly what needs adjusting.



What we are looking for



You are likely a strong fit if you:



• Have previous agency experience with English-speaking ecommerce clients

• Understand how paid ads differ from organic content

• Have exceptional attention to detail (timing, captions, visual rhythm)

• Can execute variations quickly without sacrificing quality

• Work comfortably in a high-volume testing environment

• Take ownership of your output and deadlines



Technical requirements



• Expert proficiency in Premiere Pro

• Strong working knowledge of After Effects

• Experience editing short-form ad creatives

• Excellent written English comprehension

• Reliable internet and workstation setup



Growth & progression



This is a long-term role inside a growing performance agency.



Editors who demonstrate consistency, speed, and judgement will gain:



• Greater creative autonomy

• Involvement in high-impact campaigns

• Compensation progression opportunities



Application instructions



Subject line: Senior Performance Editor – [Your Name]



Include:



• Portfolio link showing paid ad creatives ONLY

• Short description of your advertising experience

• Typical turnaround time for a 30–45 second ad



Write the word Blueberry at the top of your application.



Applications without relevant ad examples will not be reviewed.

title: Senior Graphic Designer – Performance & Paid Social Creative
description:
Salary: $800 – $1,000 USD per month

Hours: Full Time – 40 hours per week

Schedule: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM UK Time (Mon–Fri)



Overview



Stride Digital is a UK-based performance marketing agency producing high-volume advertising creatives for ecommerce brands.



We are hiring a Senior Graphic Designer with exceptional attention to detail and a strong understanding of direct-response design.



This is not a branding or logo design role.



Your work will focus exclusively on advertising performance and conversion-driven visuals.



Role focus



• Static ads and carousel creatives for paid social campaigns

• High-clarity layouts designed for mobile consumption

• Rapid variations for creative testing

• Adapting existing brand assets into performance formats

• Simple motion or slideshow-style assets when required



Performance philosophy



We optimise for clarity, hierarchy, and engagement.



We care about readability, message structure, and visual impact — not decorative design.



Workflow & environment



• Structured briefs via Trello

• Slack-based communication

• Fast feedback cycles

• High-volume creative testing culture



What we are looking for



You are likely a strong fit if you:



• Have previous agency experience with English-speaking clients

• Possess a strong portfolio of advertising creatives

• Have an excellent eye for typography and layout hierarchy

• Demonstrate meticulous attention to spacing and alignment

• Work quickly without sacrificing precision

• Understand that design success is measured by performance

title: Real Estate Investment Underwriter
description:
The Real Estate Investment Underwriter is a core decision-maker responsible for evaluating residential properties across multiple exit strategies to determine whether a deal meets the company’s investment criteria. This role directly impacts company profitability by validating assumptions, stress-testing scenarios, and ensuring every approved deal has a clear, executable path to profit.  The Underwriter is the gatekeeper of company profitability. Every deal we do, or avoid, starts with this role. Strong underwriting protects the company from bad investments and ensures capital is deployed only where risk is understood and returns are justified.



The Underwriter analyzes properties under three primary scenarios:



1) Off-Market / Investor Sale (Cash)

2) On-Market / As-Is Condition

3) On-Market / Renovate & Resell at After Repair Value (ARV)



This role is not theoretical — your numbers drive real capital deployment and are utilized for critical decisions.



The ideal DISC style is a High C / Mid D / Moderate S / Moderate I - someone who is obsessed with accuracy and data integrity, naturally skeptical of assumptions, strong at risk identification, comfortable slowing things down to get the numbers right, process oriented and analytical, loves numbers, and questions everything.  This person should be able to work independently and take ownership of outcomes while being able to defend their analysis/numbers if a deal does not work.  



Key Responsibilities



Investment Analysis & Deal Underwriting

- Analyze residential properties to determine as-is value, investor value (off market), and After Repair Value (ARV)

- Run detailed financial models for multiple exit strategies

- Validate deal viability using company investment criteria (returns, risk, timelines)

- Stress-test assumptions (pricing, repairs, hold time, market shifts)

- Clearly determine DEAL / NO DEAL decisions on opportunities



Valuation & Market Analysis

- Pull, analyze, and interpret comparable sales (on-market and off-market)

- Adjust comps accurately for condition, location, timing, and renovations

- Track market trends and pricing shifts to ensure current, defensible valuations

- Evaluate neighborhood-level risk and liquidity



Rehab & Cost Analysis

- Verify repair assumptions align with resale strategy and buyer expectations

- Apply appropriate contingency and cost buffers to protect margins



Profitability & Risk Management

- Ensure every approved deal meets required profit margins and return thresholds

- Account for all costs: acquisition, rehab, holding, financing, selling, and overhead

- Identify deal-breakers early to protect time, capital, and resources

- Flag high-risk variables before commitment



Communication & Decision Support

- Present underwriting conclusions clearly to acquisitions, leadership, and partners

- Defend valuations and assumptions with data and logic

- Provide quick, confident feedback to support fast decision-making

- Maintain underwriting documentation for accountability and post-deal review



Required Skills & Experience

- 2–5+ years in real estate underwriting, investing, acquisitions, or valuation

- Strong understanding of:

     - After Repair Value (ARV) methodology

     - Investor pricing models (70% rule, margin-based underwriting, etc.)

     - Rehab cost estimation

     - Holding costs and deal timelines

- Advanced proficiency in Excel / Google Sheets (financial modeling required)

- Deep familiarity with MLS data, comps, and market analysis

- Ability to thoroughly underwrite deals with detailed accuracy

- High attention to detail with strong judgment under pressure



Ideal Candidate Traits

- Profit-driven thinker – understands that numbers = real dollars at risk

- Decisive but disciplined – confident making DEAL / NO DEAL decisions

- Skeptical by nature – pressure-tests assumptions instead of accepting them

- Process-oriented – consistent underwriting methodology

- Ownership mindset – treats company capital like their own



Compensation

Pay rate: $8-$10 per hour, based on experience, plus bonus 

Schedule: 40 hours per week (It could be more based on workload)

Training: Yes, training will be provided.
