title: Operations Manager (Remote, Full-Time)
description:
Hello, we are looking to hire an Operations Manager to support our agency and founder with day-to-day operations and system execution.



This is not a personal assistant role and not a traditional executive assistant role.



You will design, manage, and optimize systems across the agency so everything operates smoothly, predictably, and with minimal mental overhead.



The goal is not just to complete tasks, but to reduce decision fatigue, improve organization, and create leverage through systems, structure, and proactive execution.



What success looks like in this role



• Fewer things falling through the cracks

• Clear priorities every day and week

• Tasks and projects move forward without constant reminders

• Agency operations feel structured and under control

• Less chaos, more clarity



If that sounds exciting to you, this role fits.



Core responsibilities

Daily / Ongoing



• Managing tasks, reminders, and follow-ups

• Keeping systems organized and up to date

• Tracking priorities and deadlines

• Proactively flagging issues or bottlenecks

• Communicating clearly and concisely



Weekly



• Light project management and coordination

• Reviewing open loops and unfinished items

• Improving existing systems and workflows

• Preparing summaries and operational updates



Ongoing improvement



• Creating structure where there is chaos

• Documenting processes and SOPs

• Suggesting better tools or workflows

• Learning fast and adapting to expanded responsibilities



What we care most about (non-negotiables)



Full-time dedication only

This must be your only professional role. No side jobs, no freelance work, no agencies.



High loyalty and long-term mindset

We’re looking for someone who wants stability and growth together, not short-term gigs.



Extreme attention to detail

You notice small things others miss. You double-check. You follow instructions exactly.



Ownership mentality

You don’t wait to be told what broke. You flag it, fix it, and improve the system.



Always hungry to learn

You enjoy getting better, learning tools, and expanding responsibility.



Skills and experience (flexible but important)



• Some project management experience

• Comfortable working with tasks, deadlines, and priorities

• Familiar with tools like Notion, ClickUp, Asana, Trello, Google Docs, or similar

• Strong written English

• Calm under pressure

• Organized and structured by nature



Experience matters less than how you think.



Who this role is NOT for (this saves time)



This role is not a fit if:



• You want to juggle multiple jobs

• You only want to execute tasks you’re told

• You dislike structure, systems, or documentation

• You need constant supervision

• You prefer short-term work



Questions



Question 1:

Are you comfortable working US (EST) time zone?



Question 2:

Why are you specifically looking for a full-time, long-term role instead of multiple clients or freelance work?



Question 3:

Why are you interested in this role specifically?



Question 4:

What previous experience do you have that would make you a strong fit for an Operations Manager role?



Question 5:

What tools or systems have you used to stay organized in past roles?



Important



To apply, start your application message with the word “Structure” on the first line.



Applications that do not follow this instruction will not be reviewed.



Breakdown of the initial months

First 30 days



• Execute tasks accurately

• Learn systems and expectations

• Build trust through consistency



After 60–90 days



• Proactively manage systems

• Improve workflows

• Take ownership of recurring operational areas

• Act as a second brain, not just support

This role includes building new Shopify stores, redesigning existing ones, creating landing pages inside shopify and building
s in Klaviyo. Tasks might also include creating
 newsletters, social media posts, editing images, designing ad creatives, and occasionally assisting with general design-related tasks based on your skills and our ongoing needs.



We value attention to detail, creativity, reliability, and the ability to meet deadlines. Excellent communication and design skills are crucial for success in this role.



Hours and Terms:



This is a part-time role with flexible hours. You can be paid either hourly or daily, based on an agreed schedule.



You must have a stable, fast internet connection and your own computer.



We require a quiet working environment to ensure focus and productivity.



How to Apply:

Please reply by providing:



A link to your portfolio showcasing your recent work that is relevant to this role.



A short video introducing yourself and briefly explaining your design / building experience.



Additionally, clearly answer these questions in order:



Which types of design tasks do you enjoy the most, and which do you prefer the least?

Is your internet connection reliable for regular voice and video calls?

What design software are you most proficient in? If we tell you to build the same landing page on 4 different platforms you have never used before, do you consider that a challenge?

How would you rate your English writing and speaking skills?



Looking forward to your reply.



Thank you,

Tal

title: Operations & Execution Manager (Remote) - Full Time
description:
Hello, we are looking to hire an Operations & Execution Manager to support our agency and founder with day-to-day execution, systems, and operational management.



This is not a personal assistant role.



This is not a task-only executor role.



You will help run operations, execute high-priority initiatives, manage systems, and ensure both business and logistical responsibilities move forward without friction.



The goal is not just to complete tasks, but to create structure, drive execution, reduce decision fatigue, and act as a force multiplier for the founder.



What success looks like in this role



• Fewer things falling through the cracks

• Clear priorities every day and week

• Projects move forward without constant reminders

• Systems are maintained and improved

• Execution happens fast and accurately

• The founder operates with more clarity and less chaos



If that excites you, this role fits.



Core responsibilities

Daily / Ongoing



• Managing tasks, follow-ups, and priorities

• Executing operational and administrative work

• Coordinating between tea
mbers when needed

• Tracking deadlines and ensuring completion

• Proactively flagging bottlenecks or inefficiencies

• Maintaining systems and documentation



Weekly



• Project coordination and light project management

• Reviewing open loops and unfinished items

• Improving workflows and structure

• Preparing concise operational updates



Ongoing evolution



• Creating structure where there is ambiguity

• Documenting processes and improving SOPs

• Taking ownership of recurring operational areas

• Handling special projects as needed

• Acting as a second brain, not just support



What we care most about (non-negotiables)



Full-time dedication only

This must be your only professional role. No side jobs, no freelance work, no agencies.



Long-term mindset

We are building long-term. This is not a short-term gig.



Extreme attention to detail

You double-check. You don’t miss small instructions.



Ownership mentality

You don’t wait to be told what broke. You notice, flag, and improve.



High execution speed

You move things forward quickly without sacrificing accuracy.



Calm under pressure

When things get busy, you get clearer, not chaotic.



Skills and experience (flexible but important)



• Experience in operations, project management, or execution-heavy roles

• Comfortable managing multiple priorities

• Familiar with tools like Notion, ClickUp, Asana, Trello, Google Docs, Slack, or similar

• Strong written English

• Structured thinking

• Proactive communication



Experience matters less than how you think and operate.



Who this role is NOT for



This role is not a fit if:



• You want to juggle multiple jobs

• You only want to execute tasks you’re given without thinking

• You dislike structure or documentation

• You need constant supervision

• You prefer short-term freelance work



Questions



Question 1:

Are you comfortable working US (EST) time zone?



Question 2:

Why are you specifically looking for a full-time, long-term role?



Question 3:

Why are you interested in this Operations & Execution Manager role specifically?



Question 4:

What previous experience makes you strong at both operations and execution?



Question 5:

What systems or tools have you used to stay organized in past roles?



Important



To apply, start your application message with the word “Structure” on the first line.



Applications that do not follow this instruction will not be reviewed.



Growth path

First 30 days



• Execute accurately

• Learn systems and expectations

• Build trust through consistency



After 60–90 days



• Take ownership of recurring operational areas

• Improve workflows proactively

• Anticipate needs before being told

• Operate as a true extension of the founder

title: Link Inventory Partner (50–100 Links/Month | Non-Casino | Under $100 CPL)
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE



We are hiring experienced link inventory owners | publisher relations specialists who already control real publisher relationships and can place links directly.

This is NOT an outreach-from-scratch role.

This is NOT a VA training position.

If you already place 50–100 quality links per month using your own vetted publisher list this role is a strong fit.



WHO SHOULD APPLY



You should apply ONLY if you:

-Already manage your own publisher inventory

-Place links monthly at small–medium scale | 50–100 links per month

-Work exclusively with non-casino non-adult sites

-Maintain average total cost per quality link under $100

-Understand link risk in YMYL niches | legal | business | finance



IDEAL BACKGROUND



We strongly prefer candidates who:

-Worked at SEO agencies or link-building vendors

-Operate as independent link brokers or publisher managers

-Have long-term direct publisher relationships

-Control pricing | no reseller chains | no middlemen



REQUIRED SITE TYPES | YOU MUST ALREADY HAVE THESE



Your existing list should include:

-Business | legal | finance blogs

-Editorial websites with real traffic

-News-style or authority publications

-Guest-post-friendly sites with manual review

-Clean domains | no spam | no penalties



WE ARE NOT INTERESTED IN

-PBNs or expired-domain networks

-Link farms or auto-approve sites

-Casino | adult | CBD | crypto-heavy properties

-Mass outreach operators without owned relationships

-"We can try to find sites" applicants



PRICING LIMITS | STRICT



We buy links ONLY within these ceilings:

-DR 45–50 -> up to $45

-DR 50–55 -> up to $55

-DR 55–60 -> up to $70

-DR 60–65 -> up to $90



RULES

-Dofollow + contextual only

-Permanent placement

-Minimum link life | 3 years

-Blended average CPL must stay under $100



HOW THIS WORKS



You share your existing site list with:

-URL

-DR

-Traffic

-Niche

-Your price



We select approved sites

Orders placed in monthly batches

Payment made per live placement



No cold outreach

No guessing

No wasted time



WHAT WE PRIORITIZE

-Monthly repeat buying

-Bulk orders

-Long-term partnerships

-Predictable delivery

-Clean execution | anchors | relevance | footprint control



HOW TO APPLY



Send the following:

-A sample list of sites you already control | Google Sheet preferred

-Your realistic monthly volume capacity

-Your preferred payment method



Subject line:

-Link Inventory Partner | Your Name

title: Content Operations Lead (Own Writer Team + Delivery Responsibility)
description:
==================================================

IMPORTANT – READ THIS FIRST

==================================================



We are NOT hiring writers. We are hiring ONE person who already manages writers and can fully own a content delivery pipeline.



If you are a writer, VA, or someone who plans to hire writers after joining, this role is NOT for you.





==================================================

ROLE SUMMARY

==================================================



You will own the delivery of high-quality, human-written, long-form content at scale. We already have a senior editor who reviews and approves quality. Your responsibility is delivery.



You will:

- Manage writers

- Ensure content is delivered on time

- Replace underperforming writers

- Hit monthly volume consistently



You own output. We do not micromanage.





==================================================

WHAT YOU WILL OWN

==================================================



- A team of 5+ writers (your responsibility, not ours)

- Writer onboarding and replacement

- Daily and weekly content delivery

- Meeting monthly word targets

- Ensuring content is NOT AI-generated or generic



You will NOT:

- Write articles yourself

- Ask us to hire writers

- Ask us to manage day-to-day tasks





==================================================

CONTENT TYPE

==================================================



- Long-form articles (1,500–3,000 words)

- Practical, experience-based content

- Pain-killer content that removes confusion

- Not fluff, definitions, or AI-style writing



We provide:

- Detailed outlines

- Editorial direction

- Feedback from a senior editor





==================================================

REQUIREMENTS (MANDATORY)

==================================================



You MUST meet ALL of the following:

- Currently or previously managed at least 5 writers

- Delivered 200,000+ words per month before

- Understand how to enforce quality at scale

- Can replace writers quickly if quality drops

- Comfortable owning delivery end-to-end

- Want a long-term role (6–12 months minimum)



If you cannot meet ALL of the above, do NOT apply.





==================================================

COMPENSATION

==================================================



- Fixed monthly pay (not per article or per word)

- Stable, long-term engagement



Compensation depends on demonstrated capacity and quality. You are expected to manage writer payments within your own structure.





==================================================

TRIAL / VALIDATION

==================================================



Before full onboarding:

- Short paid pilot

- Small batch of articles

- Quality reviewed by our editor



If quality and delivery are strong, we scale immediately.





==================================================

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS (IMPORTANT)

==================================================



To apply, reply with ALL of the following:



1. How many writers do you currently manage?

2. What niches have your teams written in?

3. Maximum monthly word volume you can reliably deliver

4. How you ensure writers do NOT use AI

5. One example of content your team produced (editor-approved)



Applications that do not answer ALL 5 questions will be rejected without response.





==================================================

FINAL NOTE

==================================================



This role is for someone who wants to OWN a system, not do tasks. If you are looking for stability, long-term work, and responsibility, this will be a good fit.

title: Ecommerce Executive (Shopee, Lazada, Tiktok Seller Center, Big Seller)
description:
URGENT HIRING



Join our team and become part of a dynamic, global organization of 40 professionals across Korea, Singapore, Malaysia, and the Philippines. Collaborate closely with our regional teams to grow an exciting portfolio of leading Korean brands, including Beauty of Joseon, Needly, Tirtir, and other top-trending names in the market.



We are seeking a confident and experienced tea
mber who can independently oversee e-commerce operations, take proactive initiative, and consistently deliver results with minimal supervision, ensuring long-term success and stability in the role.



Key Responsibilities:



- Serve as the Point-in-Charge (PIC) and technical expert for the BigSeller platform, providing system guidance, troubleshooting, and workflow optimization.

- Stay updated on BigSeller feature releases and system enhancements, implementing updates to improve operational efficiency.

- Manage product listings across multiple online platforms (Shopee, Lazada, TikTok Shop), ensuring accuracy, quality, and completeness (basic photo editing and product research).

- Monitor pricing strategies and campaign promotions (e.g., 11.11, 12.12, Payday Sales) to drive sales growth performance.

- Track and analyze sales data, competitor activity, inventory levels, and shipment status, preparing actionable performance reports.

- Confidently present weekly and monthly data to management, translating complex metrics into clear strategies.

- Maintain overall e-commerce account health, coordinating with teams to resolve customer service issues, refunds, returns, and fraud cases.

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams and provide ad-hoc support for campaigns and special projects.



Qualifications:



- 3–4 years of hands-on experience managing e-commerce operations on Shopee, Lazada, TikTok Seller Centre or Bigseller Account, or similar is required.

- Strong understanding of online campaign management, pricing strategies, and platform algorithms.

- Proficient in Google sheets and Excel. Managing large datasets, utilizing advanced formulas (e.g., VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables), and generating performance reports.

- Highly organized, able to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

- Strong communication skills with the ability to work effectively in multicultural teams.

- Seeking a dedicated full-time and long term role.





Benefits:

- Stable full time employment with leave benefits, up to 14 days annual leave, public holiday leave, birthday leave.

- Travel Opportunity to Singapore based on performance.

- Comfortable work environment, same working time zone as Philippines (GMT +8).

- Structured salary increase and promotion based on performance.



To apply, please answer a few short pre-screening questions via the Google Form linked below. This helps us better understand your background and fit for the role before the interview stage







We appreciate your interest and look forward to hearing from you!

title: Marketing Operations Coordinator (Remote, Full-Time)
description:
Marketing Operations Coordinator (Remote, Full-Time)



UGC Mastery Academy

- This is an operations-first role.

- Not a strategist.

- Not a creative lead.

- Not a VA.



ABOUT UGC MASTERY ACADEMY:



UGC Mastery Academy is a fast-growing online education company helping people build real income through content creation.



We run:

- Weekly webinars

- High-volume
 & SMS campaigns

- Paid ads

- Multiple Front Mentors and funnels



We’re now hiring a Marketing Operations Coordinator to take day-to-day execution off the CMO and ensure marketing runs smoothly, consistently, and without constant oversight.



THE ROLE (READ THIS CAREFULLY):



This role exists to run marketing operations reliably.



- Your job is not to d
 strategy.

- Your job is to execute correctly, consistently, and on time.

- If you are detail-oriented, systems-driven, and take pride in things running properly — this role will suit you very well.

- If you want to “do strategy” without mastering execution first — this role is not for you.



WHAT YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:



Core Marketing Operations

- You will fully own the execution of:

-
 marketing campaigns (setup, scheduling, QA)

- SMS hand-raiser and broadcast campaigns

- Weekly webinar setup and checks

- Paid ads uploads and campaign setup (execution only)

- Daily and weekly KPI tracking

- Marketing operations reporting

- Everything will be done using clear SOPs.



Your goal is simple:

???? Marketing runs every week without issues

???? The CMO does not need to check your work



WHAT YOU WILL NOT BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:



- You will not create marketing strategy

- You will not write ad copy or core messaging

- You will not manage budgets or optimise ads

- You will not be expected to “figure everything out alone”

- This role is about excellent execution, not guessing.



WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE:



First 30 Days:

-
, SMS, webinar, and ad launches run on time

- No missed sends or broken setups

- Weekly reporting delivered without reminders

- CMO time spent on execution reduced significantly



After 2–3 Months:

- Marketing operations feel calm and predictable

- You can handle execution independently

- You begin taking on additional responsibility as trust grows



GROWTH & UPSIDE:



This role is designed to grow with you.

- Start focused on execution

- Earn more responsibility as you prove reliability

- Take ownership of larger systems over time

- Compensation increases as scope increases



If you are consistent, dependable, and proactive, there is a clear path to:

- Higher monthly pay

- More ownership

- A senior operations role inside the company



COMPENSATION:



- Monthly pay: $500–$1,000 USD (based on experience)

- Increases tied to responsibility and performance

- Long-term, stable role

- Fully remote

- We pay for reliability and ownership, not hours worked.



WHO THIS ROLE IS FOR:



You are a good fit if:

- You are highly organised and detail-oriented

- You enjoy running systems and following processes

- You take responsibility seriously

- You want a long-term role with growth

- You are comfortable executing someone else’s strategy very well



WHO SHOULD NOT APPLY:



Please do not apply if:

- You are looking for a marketing strategist role

- You want to “learn marketing” on the job

- You dislike SOPs or structure

- You need constant supervision

- You are only looking for short-term freelance work



HOW TO APPLY:



1) To apply, please include:



2) Your OnlineJobs.ph profile



3) A short written answer to this question:

Describe a time you were responsible for running a process or system.

What was your role, and how did you make sure nothing went wrong?



Applications without this answer will not be reviewed.

title: Full Stack Developer - 3 POSITIONS AVAILABLE
description:
This role is full time UK business hours.



We're a business that provides kick ass software / print services to travel businesses. We're looking for competent / experienced full stack developers to join our team and help make our software the best it can be. The skills you need are:



REALLY GOOD SPOKEN / WRITTEN ENGLISH

GOOD MATHS

PHP

HTML / CSS

Javascript (AJAX / JSON)

MySQL



If you're the guy (or gal) your developer friends come to when they're stuck, then we want you on our team! We're not looking for 'another developer' w're looking for people who want to become part of our business 'family'. You need to be prepared to work hard and in return we'll provide good pay, a great environment and job security. Lastly you need to be passionate about travel! 



You'll learn all about how vacations / holidays are made (packaged) and the 'official' things that have to happen in the background, including how we ensure suppliers are paid and customers receive the right documentation etc...



For the right person this is a job for life; 13 months pay (each year), bonus payments when targets are met, and a family first approach. Need  to fit your working day around collecting your children from school - no problem, need to take time out to cook / shop for your parents - no problem. We want you to be 120% happy and create a better life for you and your family. 



We understand that electricity and internet can be intermittent sometimes in the Philippines. If we need to buy you a solar battery bank to keep your laptop charged and router connected - we will. If we need to get you spaceX internet - we will. 



Sometimes things get lost in translation, so we asked Darlynne (our Philippines Team Leader) to share her thoughts on what its like to work for us:



---



Mga kababayan ko (in the tune of Francis M)



Witty ng intro ko, no? Haha! I hope from that ramdam niyo na we foster a positive and fun culture dito. Teamwork to the highest level! What’s even better is the work-life balance. Yung business owner (Tim) ay mabait at sobrang understanding, so kung may kailangan kang asikasuhin (lalo na if it’s about family) magsabi ka lang. We will always understand. 



Since we provide a strong and supportive working environment, mataas din ang expectations namin sa inyo. Kailangan hardworking ka, responsible, at marunong mag-manage ng tasks mo. Relaxed ang environment, pero challenging ang trabaho, ha? We’re a software company that works with major holiday brands, kaya expected ang high-quality output at all times.



Kailangan talaga magaling ka sa English — both spoken and written. Hindi yung umaasa lang sa Google Translate, kundi talagang kaya mong makipag-usap nang maayos at malinaw. Importante kasi na madali ka maintindihan ng UK team at ng clients. At ikaw din, dapat naiintindihan mo sila. Kung feeling mo kailangan mo pang i-improve ang english mo, okay lang ‘yan! Mag-practice ka muna then apply ka ulit after 6 months 



The company is growing, and marami pang opportunities coming for those who are willing to grow with us. Kung gusto mo ng challenge at long-term growth, magandang opportunity ito.



I’m so excited to welcome you to our family!



---



IF YOU APPLIED PREVIOUSLY AND ARE STILL KEEN TO JOIN OUR TEAM, PLEASE RE-APPLY BUT LET US KNOW YOU APPLIED BEFORE AND TELL US WHAT YOU'VE DONE TO IMPROVE YOUR SKILLS SINCE WHEN YOU LAST APPLIED.



To apply for this role you must complete an application using the link below:

title: Digital Marketing Strategist
description:
Calling all visionary digital marketers!

Growing Being is seeking a talented Digital Marketing Strategist to lead our journey from a thriving company to an internationally recognized luxury brand. If you’re ready to bring creativity, strategy, and expertise to the table, read on!



What You’ll Do:



Develop powerful scripts for content that inspires and engages our audience.

Manage all social media platforms with an emphasis on consistency, luxury, and growth.

(Preferred) Strategize and execute ad campaigns and funnels for maximum impact.



Requirements

What You Bring:

You’re a strategic thinker with a passion for luxury branding.

You have a proven track record in social media management and content creation.

You’re skilled at writing scripts and developing campaigns that drive engagement.

Experience with ads, funnels, and analytics to drive measurable results.



Benefits

What’s in It for You:

Be a key player in elevating a brand that transforms lives globally.

Work with a passionate and collaborative team.

title: Graphic & animation (Digital Creator)
description:
We are seeking a creative and committed Digital Creator with a strong foundation in both 2D and 3D animation (mainly 2D), a keen eye for design, and a passion for visual storytelling. The main focus of this role is editing modules and producing graphics that elevate our coaching content and programs.



As part of our creative team, you’ll help bring our educational materials and brand visuals to life — while maintaining alignment with our values of growth, compassion, courage, and resilience.



Key Responsibilities:

- Edit and refine module videos, including motion graphics and animations.

- Create eye-catching 2D and 3D animations for learning modules, social media, and digital campaigns.

- Design graphics, illustrations, and visual assets that reflect the brand aesthetic and enhance user engagement.

- Work closely with our Creative Director to translate ideas into visual form.

- Collaborate and iterate based on feedback — receptive to guidance and dedicated to improvement.

- Maintain organized project files and meet delivery timelines consistently.



Requirements

What We’re Looking For:

- Proficiency in 2D & 3D animation and relevant editing tools (e.g., After Effects, Blender, Cinema 4D, Premiere Pro, etc.).

- Strong graphic design sensibilities and comfort with visual storytelling.

- A self-starter who can manage time effectively within a 40-hour work week.

- Ability to take constructive feedback with openness and incorporate it into work.

- 100% commitment to delivering quality and growing with the team.

- Strong communication and collaboration skills — you contribute ideas and also listen to direction.

- Attention to detail, adaptability, and a willingness to learn and evolve.



Benefits

Flexible hours.

At Growing Being, our mission is to help people discover their true worth, heal their past, and unlock their full potential by guiding them to live with love, purpose, and wholeness. Our values are rooted in compassion, courage, joy, and resilience, and we foster a culture where personal growth isn’t just encouraged — it’s inevitable. title: Social Media & Ads Manager.
description:
We're looking for a full-time Social Media & Ads Manager to handle content creation, social media management, and paid advertising for a faith-based brand with a growing podcast, Substack, and online business. This is a fully remote, asynchronous position. Communication happens through Basecamp.



What You'll Be Doing



Content Creation & Social Media Management



You'll take podcast episodes, Substack articles, and B-roll footage and turn them into platform-specific content across Instagram, TikTok, YouTube Shorts, Pinterest, LinkedIn,
/X, and
. This includes:



Clipping and editing podcast episodes into short-form video clips with hooks, captions, and platform-native formatting

Creating Instagram carousels from podcast transcripts and Substack articles using Canva templates and a custom GPT

Building and resizing content for each platform (vertical for TikTok/Instagram/YouTube, square for LinkedIn, landscape for
, 2:3 for Pinterest)

Writing captions for all platforms using a custom GPT

Creating static and video pins for Pinterest with SEO-optimized titles and descriptions

Producing B-roll videos from existing footage with trending concepts

Promoting weekly Substack articles through 
 static pins and
 posts

Promoting lead magnets through Instagram posts with ManyChat automations and Pinterest pins

Building ManyChat keyword automations for Instagram carousels and lead magnet promotions

Managing Pinterest boards, repinning evergreen content, and tracking search trends

Cross-posting content to

Researching trending content ideas weekly and presenting them for approval





Meta Ads Management

You'll manage
 and Instagram ad campaigns with a monthly budget of $500-$1,500. This includes:



Running 1-3 campaigns at a time (new leads, lookalike audiences, retargeting, and launch campaigns as needed)

Building all ad creative (images, video, copy) and submitting for approval

A/B testing 3-5 creative variations per campaign, changing one variable at a time

Monitoring campaign performance daily (CPL, CTR, CPC, frequency, relevance score)

Flagging issues on Basecamp when campaigns need attention

Scaling winners and cutting underperformers (with approval)

Delivering a weekly ads report every Monday on Basecamp





Reporting

Weekly ads report with spend, results, creative performance, and recommendations

Monthly social media report (due by the 5th of the following month) covering platfor
trics, top-performing content, hook performance, platform growth, Pinterest search trends, and specific recommendations for the following month





Administrative & Special Projects



Assist with administrative tasks and special projects as needed.



Weekly Volume

This is the approximate weekly output across all platforms:

TikTok: 7 videos + 2 carousels

Instagram: 2 reels + 3-4 B-roll videos + 3 carousels + 3 lead magnet posts

YouTube Shorts: 7

LinkedIn: 0-2

/X: 2-4

Pinterest: 5 video pins + 3 static pins + 2-3 idea pins + 3-5 Substack pins + 3 lead magnet pins

: 3 Substack promotion posts + cross-posts from TikTok and LinkedIn

ManyChat automations: 2-3 per week (plus lead magnet automations)

Meta ads: 1-3 active campaigns with daily monitoring





Many clips are reformatted across platforms, so the unique content created per week is approximately 20-30 pieces.





Tools You'll Use

Opus Clips / Opus Pro (clip selection and captions)

Canva (carousels, pins, cover images, ad creative)

Custom GPTs (caption writing, carousel creation, Substack promotion)

ManyChat (Instagram DM automations)

Meta Ads Manager (campaign management)

Google Drive (transcripts, video uploads)

TikTok (native captioning)

Basecamp (all communication)

Google Sheets (approval spreadsheet, reporting)



Requirements

Experience managing social media accounts across multiple platforms

Experience running Meta 
/Instagram) ad campaigns including A/B testing

Proficiency in Canva

Experience with ManyChat or similar DM automation tools

Understanding of Pinterest SEO and search-based content strategy

Ability to edit short-form video (clipping, adding hooks, captions, sound effects)

Strong written English

Self-directed and organized enough to manage a high volume of deliverables asynchronously

Comfortable working independently with weekly check-ins rather than daily supervision





Details

Full-time, remote

$850/month

Fully asynchronous via Basecamp (no required overlap with US business hours)

Start date: TBD

title: Hiring Executive Team: Gamers Wanted
description:
We're looking to hire a full team of VA's to work with us launching TikTok ad campaigns for our agency, RedStream Consulting (
).



There are multiple positions to be filled based on experience. We're looking for data entry VA's, team leaders, managers, video editors, media buyers, and project leads.



Pay starts at $600 a month and increases with performance. We reward performance and timeliness. 



Roles currently available:



1. Business Center Creators:  You will be responsible for creating TikTok business centers daily for us that we run ads on. Everything is clearly defined, and simple to execute. SOPs that teach everything take 30 minutes to finish. Only real qualifying trait we're looking for is full availability during working hours to communicate with team, and attention to detail. Fast workers will be able to create 6 business centers an hour, normal workers around 4 an hour. We're looking for fast.



2. Form Creators: You will work with the business center creators above to populate each business center with forms (standard TikTok advertising options) following our instructions. 



3. Campaign Creators: You'll create campaigns inside the business centers. Gaming computer needed here because it's simple task but needs lots of tabs open. If computer is weak, that's the bottleneck. (example: on a decent computer it takes 5 minutes to do this task, on a slow computer can take 30)



4. Top Up Specialists: High trust position, highest pay. You'll be trusted with our credit cards and asked to top up the ad accounts inside the business centers on a set cadence (once every 15 minutes for example). You'll also be looking at metrics to see which ones are worth topping up, and which ones are not. Attention to detail and financial responsibility very important here.  We require two of these positions per pod. Candidates with ACCOUNTING background preferred.



Quick video explaining how the team will function together: 



To apply, answer the following q's in a QUICK LOOM VIDEO. I need to see what you're like and looms are the best way of doing it. 60 second length is enough as long as you explain the q's below:



1. Which position are you interested in?

2. 8 hours a day shifts, are you okay with that?

3. Do you have a gaming PC? List the specs if yes.

4. Do you have any prior experience running ads, being inside business centers or ads dashboards?

5. Why are you looking for work right now?



PS: After initial trial period, performance will be HEAVILY rewarded



Looking forward to scaling together!

title: Virtual Assistant – Real Estate & Mortgage (Stable High-Performance Environment)
description:
Virtual Assistant – Real Estate & Mortgage (Stable High-Performance Environment)



We are building a stable, structured, high-performance lead handling system for a real estate and mortgage brokerage in Washington State.



This is not a freelance gig.

This is a long-term professional role with clear expectations, strict structure, and strong bonus upside.



At the very top of your application, write the words:

Structured Performance Operator



Applications without this phrase will not be considered.



WHAT YOU WILL DO



Your #1 priority: Speed to Lead



- Call new leads within 1–3 minutes of arrival

- Confirm inquiry (MLS home search requests)

- Qualify: Cash buyer or financing needed

- Send mortgage application link (if financing required)

- Schedule loan consultation appointment

- Log EVERYTHING in CRM



After new leads are handled:

- CRM follow-up tasks

- Appointment reminder calls

- SMS reminders through CRM

- CRM cleanup and organization

- Later expansion: recruitment calls, partner outreach (after system stabilization)



All calls and messages must go through CRM.

A US RingCentral number will be provided.



WORK SCHEDULE



We operate 7 days per week.

Two shift VAs cover the week with structured handoff periods.

Each VA works approximately 36 hours per week, including brief handoff overlap.



Each VA works approximately 3 full days (10-hour shifts) and 1 partial day (approximately 6 hours).

You do NOT work 7 days per week.

Each VA has multiple full days off every week.



This is a fixed schedule role.



COMPENSATION



Base Salary: $650/month

Paid twice per month:

- $325 on the 1st

- $325 on the 15th



Base salary is paid regardless of closings.



PERFORMANCE BONUSES (PAID AFTER CLOSING)



Bonuses are paid in the payroll cycle following confirmed transaction closing and after commission/funds are received.



Initiator Bonuses (paid only if the transaction closes):



- $10 – Completed mortgage application

(paid to the VA who sent the link, drove completion, and logged it in CRM)



- $10 – Loan appointment that shows up and results in closing

(paid to the VA who scheduled and logged it in CRM)



- $10 – Cash buyer appointment that results in closing

(paid to the VA who scheduled and logged it in CRM)



Transaction Closing Bonus:



- $200 per closed transaction



This bonus is shared between the two shift VAs who worked the lead during the process.

The initiating VA (who initiated the mortgage application or appointment in CRM) receives the larger portion.

The supporting shift VA receives the remaining portion. Exact split defined during onboarding.



Teamwork matters. Follow-up matters.



PERFORMANCE EXPECTATIONS



At 60-day review, we expect total earnings (base + bonuses) to reach approximately $1,200/month once the system is fully operating.



Top performers should be able to earn up to $2,000/month in strong production months as volume increases.



Earnings are performance-based and not guaranteed.



SYSTEM RULES



- ALL calls must go through CRM.

- ALL SMS must go through CRM.

- RingCentral number is for business use only.

- Calls are recorded.

- Speed to Lead is mandatory.



Intentional bypass of CRM communication process or misuse of RingCentral may result in immediate termination.



TO APPLY (REQUIRED)



Answer clearly in numbered format:



1) Can you consistently respond to new leads within 1–3 minutes during your entire shift?

Explain how you ensure this technically (workflow, notifications, monitoring).



2) Describe your specific experience handling inbound real estate buyer leads (not cold calling).

Include:

- Type of leads

- Volume per day

- Conversion goal



3) List all CRM systems you have used and describe your level of usage (basic / advanced / automation / reporting).

If you have not used BoldTrail or KV Core, explain how quickly you learn new CRM systems.



4) During your shift hours, how many active conversations (calls + SMS + follow-ups) can you handle per day without missing Speed to Lead targets?



5) Confirm clearly:

You will make 100% of calls and send 100% of SMS strictly inside our CRM system only.

No exceptions.



6) Confirm clearly:

You will not use RingCentral for any personal or unauthorized activity under any circumstances.



7) Describe your internet setup:

- Primary provider

- Speed (upload/download)

- Backup connection

- Power backup (if any)



8) Write a short sample call opening script for a brand-new inbound buyer lead requesting MLS access.

The script must:

- Confirm their request

- Ask cash vs financing

- Move toward scheduling a loan consultation if financing is needed



Applications without direct numbered answers will not be considered.

title: Senior Video Editor (including motion graphics and Ai video)
description:
We’re DMB Films — a UK video agency creating high-quality, story-led content for corporate/internal communications, employer brand, training and documentary-style films. We’re looking for a senior, agency-level editor who can take footage and shape it into polished, engaging edits — with strong creative judgment, clean finishing, and confidence with motion graphics.



This is not a “churn out timelines” role — it’s for someone who understands pace, story, tone, sound, and polish, and can handle feedback like a pro.



What you’ll be doing



Core editing



 • Edit short and long-form corporate/internal films: interviews + b-roll, event coverage, campaign content, training, recruitment, and social cutdowns.

 • Build strong narrative structure from real-world footage (sometimes minimal direction).

 • Deliver agency-level finishing:

 • tight pacing and clean transitions

 • strong music choices (when appropriate)

 • clean audio (dialogue clarity is everything)

 • subtitles/captions and simple graphics where needed

 • Create multiple versions efficiently (different durations, formats, and platforms).



Motion graphics (After Effects)



 • Design and animate:

 • lower thirds, title cards, openers, end slates

 • simple kinetic typography

 • stat/number callouts and on-screen text

 • infographic 2D animations

 • branded templates that can be reused



AI-assisted video workflows (responsible use)



We’re excited by AI as a tool, not a shortcut. You’ll use AI to improve speed and quality, for example:



 • transcription / captioning

 • rough assemblies

 • cleanup tasks (audio enhancement, upscaling, rotoscoping, object removal where appropriate)

 • experimenting with AI-supported motion/graphics workflows



You’ll always keep outputs brand-safe and client-appropriate, and we’ll be clear on what tools are approved for each project.



What “good” looks like



 • You can take a brief + footage + notes and make smart editorial decisions without hand-holding.

 • You keep projects organised, versioned correctly, and easy to review.

 • You communicate clearly, flag risks early, and deliver on time.

 • You care about craft: sound, rhythm, structure, and the tiny details clients notice.



Requirements (must-have)



 • 5+ years professional editing experience (agency, studio, or in-house brand team)

 • Excellent editing in Adobe Premiere Pro (or equivalent, but Premiere preferred)

 • Strong working knowledge of After Effects for motion graphics

 • Strong storytelling instincts + pacing + editorial judgment

 • Solid audio approach (dialogue clarity, levelling, basic cleanup)

 • Comfortable with feedback and revision cycles (
-style notes)

 • Reliable internet + dependable computer setup

 • Able to overlap a few hours with UK working time for feedback (not full UK hours)



Nice-to-have



 • Experience in corporate/internal comms, employer brand, or documentary-style edits

 • Understanding of brand guidelines and template-based editing

 • Familiarity with tools like 
, Dropbox/Drive, Notion/Monday-style workflows

 • Colour correction confidence (clean, natural corporate look)

 • Experience creating reusable motion templates for lower thirds/titles

title: Experienced Photo Editor & Graphic Designer

title: ClickUp Expert — Workspace Setup for Media & Content Business
description:
We run a luxury travel agency and an online travel education course as part of a larger media brand. We're a small team of 3 with no project management system in place. We need an experienced ClickUp expert to build a workspace from scratch and train us on how to use it.

Our business has two core areas that need organising:

1. Travel Agency (Luxury Hotel Bookings)

We handle high-end hotel booking requests from clients. We need a system to manage:

— New client enquiries and lead tracking

— Booking requests in progress (hotel, dates, status, special requests, VIP amenities)

— Client communication follow-ups and reminders

— Post-trip follow-ups and feedback

— A clear view of all active bookings and their status at a glance

2. Online Course (Video Education Product)

We run an online course that requires ongoing maintenance and updates. We need a system to manage:

— Video content that needs updating or re-recording

— New lessons or modules in production

— Tasks related to course launches and promotions

— Student support tickets and common issues

— Affiliate marketing tasks and tracking

What we expect you to deliver:

title: Personal Virtual Assistant -- Organized, Proactive, AI-Friendly
description:
## Job Title



Personal Virtual Assistant -- Organized, Proactive, AI-Friendly



## Job Description



I'm a tech entrepreneur running multiple projects (a software company, investments, and a DJ side business). I'm looking for a sharp, organized virtual assistant to be my right hand on the operations side of things.



This isn't a typical VA role. **You'll essentially be my number two** -- helping me run things, not just checking off tasks. I need someone who takes ownership, builds systems, thinks strategically, and holds me accountable. If I'm dragging my feet on something, I expect you to follow up and push me to get it done. If you're someone who waits quietly for the next task, this isn't the right fit.



### What You'll Be Doing



- **Document & file organization** -- Organizing Google Drive, cloud storage, and local files. Building folder structures and naming conventions. Proactively thinking about ways to improve our efficiency and readiness for taxes and other document-heavy events -- not just organizing once, but creating systems that stay organized.

- **Personal admin & gifting** -- Researching and ordering gifts for friends, family, and business contacts. Handling purchases and managing recurring personal tasks that keep falling through the cracks.

- **Travel booking & points optimization** -- Booking travel, tracking my points balances across programs, and recommending the best way to use them for each trip. Proactively flagging deals and redemption opportunities.

- **Calendar & scheduling** -- Coordinating meetings, blocking focus time, keeping me on track.

- **Sales operations & client support** -- I handle the selling, but you help close the loop. Sending out DocuSigns, following up with clients, preparing contracts and consulting agreements, and handling the admin side of closing deals.

- **Copywriting** -- Drafting copy for consulting proposals, client-facing
s, social media posts, and other communications as needed.

- **Product & market research** -- Researching competitors, market positioning, and user needs for new applications I'm building. You'll be my thought partner on this, not just a data gatherer.

- **AI tools & marketing research** -- Staying on top of new AI tools and marketing strategies. Identifying what we should be using and how to implement them.

- **Content summarization** -- Summarizing articles, reports, and content I haven't had time to read. We'll build an AI-assisted workflow for this together.



### What Makes You Stand Out



**You're a systematizer.** The first time you do something, you document it. You create SOPs, checklists, and templates so it never has to be figured out twice. You think in systems, not one-off tasks.



**You're proactive and direct.** You don't wait to be told what to do next. You see what needs doing and you flag it. You're comfortable being frank with me -- if something is falling behind, you say so.



**You're organized and trustworthy.** You manage details without dropping balls. You handle sensitive information (finances, personal accounts) with discretion.



**You can think independently.** When I give you a goal, you figure out the steps. You don't need every decision made for you.



### Required Skills



- Strong English communication (written and verbal)

- Google Workspace (Drive, Docs, Sheets, Calendar)

- Notion (or similar project management/knowledge base tools)

- Comfortable with video calls and async communication



### Nice to Have



- Experience with AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, etc.) -- I'm happy to teach this if you're a fast learner

- Ability to set up Slack integrations and automations

- Experience with travel booking and points/miles optimization

- Previous experience as a personal or executive assistant

- Bookkeeping or basic financial organization experience



### Schedule & Compensation



- **Starting at 10 hours/week** with the opportunity to scale to full-time as we build trust and the workload grows

- **$300/month retainer** to start

- Flexible hours -- I care about output, not when you're online

- Long-term role -- I'm looking for someone to grow with, not a short-term hire



### How to Apply



Please include in your application:



1. A brief intro about yourself and your experience as a VA

2. Tell me about a time you created a system or process that made your client's life easier

3. What AI tools do you currently use, if any? (It's okay if the answer is none -- I value honesty over a padded resume)

4. Your availability and preferred working hours



I'll be doing a 30-minute video interview with shortlisted candidates, followed by a small paid test task so we can both see if the fit is right.

title: Freelance Shopify Developer (Ongoing Support Partner)
description:
We are looking for a reliable, experienced freelance Shopify developer to support our e-commerce store on an ongoing, as-needed basis.



This is a long-term working relationship, not a full-time hire. We want to build a trusted partnership with one or two developers we can consistently rely on for website improvements, troubleshooting, and custom development work.



Remote candidates are preferred.



About the Role



We regularly need technical Shopify support for tasks that go beyond what our internal team can complete, including:



Theme edits and customizations



Coding support and bug fixing



App integrations and troubleshooting



Performance improvements and technical clean-up



Rather than working with agencies or rotating freelancers, we want a dependable developer who understands our store over time and can provide consistent support when needed.



Key Responsibilities



Shopify theme editing and customization



Working with Liquid (Shopify templating language)



Front-end development using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript



App integrations, troubleshooting, and resolving conflicts



Fixing bugs, layout issues, and mobile responsiveness problems



Performance optimization and site speed improvements



Supporting ongoing site enhancements and feature requests



What We’re Looking For



We are looking for someone who is:



Highly experienced with Shopify development (not just basic setup)



Strong in Liquid, theme architecture, and front-end implementation



Comfortable diagnosing issues and proposing solutions



Reliable, responsive, and able to meet reasonable turnaround times



A clear communicator who can work well with a remote team



Experienced supporting mid- to high-AOV e-commerce brands (preferred)



Preferred Candidate Profile



Priority will be given to developers based in regions with strong technical talent and reasonable pricing, such as:



Eastern Europe



Southeast Asia



South America



We generally avoid high-cost regions (UK/US) unless exceptional value is demonstrated.



Screening Questions (Required in Application)



Please include answers to the following:



What Shopify stores or projects have you worked on recently? (Links/examples preferred)



What is your experience with Liquid and custom theme development?



Are you comfortable troubleshooting app conflicts and complex store setups?



What is your typical availability and turnaround time for small fixes?



Do you work hourly, project-based, or both? Please share your rate range.



What time zone are you in, and are you comfortable working asynchronously?



Engagement Structure



Ongoing freelance support



Work assigned on an as-needed basis (small edits to larger custom tasks)



Potential to become our long-term go-to Shopify partner



How to Apply



Please apply with:



A short introduction



Relevant Shopify experience



Examples of past work



Answers to the screening questions above



We are reviewing candidates on a rolling basis and will shortlist for a quick interview/chat.



Thank you — we look forward to finding a strong long-term development partner.

title: Full-Time Bookkeeper
description:
About Us

At TaxAce, we provide expert financial services including Tax Preparation, Bookkeeping, Payroll, Agent Service of Process, Tax Resolution, Tax Planning, and CFO Services for businesses and entrepreneurs.



We’re guided by five core values:

• Integrity – Transparent guidance for informed decisions

• Communication – Clear, timely support that builds trust

• Accountability – Goal-focused with measurable results

• Respect – Personalized service with professionalism

• Education – Ongoing learning to stay ahead of tax changes

Our mission is to deliver reliable, high-quality financial support that empowers clients to grow with confidence.



Who You Are

You’re a Certified Public Accountant (CPA) who thrives in an organized, fast-paced environment. With a knack for numbers and a commitment to accuracy, you bring value by streamlining financial records, identifying trends, and ensuring compliance.



Key Responsibilities

• Maintain accurate financial records for a variety of clients

• Process accounts payable and receivable, bank reconciliations, and payroll

• Prepare monthly, quarterly, and year-end financial reports

• Collaborate with tax professionals during tax season and audits

• Manage multiple client accounts in QuickBooks Online

• Reconcile credit card and bank statements

• Ensure compliance with GAAP and internal accounting policies

• Communicate regularly with clients to collect necessary documentation and clarify discrepancies



Qualifications

• CPA designation (required)

• Minimum of 2 years of professional bookkeeping or accounting experience

• Proficiency in QuickBooks Online, Excel, and cloud-based bookkeeping tools

• Strong understanding of accrual accounting and financial reporting

• Excellent time management and organizational skills

• Strong communication skills, both verbal and written



Preferred Skills

• QuickBooks Online ProAdvisor certification (a plus)

• Experience working with tax firms or accounting practices

• Experience in Xero (a plus)

• Familiarity with payroll systems and third-party integrations

• Ability to handle multiple client accounts concurrently

• Comfortable working in a remote, collaborative environment



Compensation & Benefits

• Competitive salary (based on experience)

• Flexible work hours

• Professional development support (CE credits, licensing fees, etc.)

• Performance bonuses



How to Apply

If
 is not visible, please apply through the platform job posting.

title: Editorial Operations Manager – Manage Writers, Own Output (Not a Writer Role)
description:
==================================================

IMPORTANT – READ THIS FIRST

==================================================



We are NOT hiring writers. We are hiring ONE person who already manages writers and can fully own a content delivery pipeline.



If you are a writer, VA, or someone who plans to hire writers after joining, this role is NOT for you.





==================================================

ROLE SUMMARY

==================================================



You will own the delivery of high-quality, human-written, long-form content at scale. We already have a senior editor who reviews and approves quality. Your responsibility is delivery.



You will:

- Manage writers

- Ensure content is delivered on time

- Replace underperforming writers

- Hit monthly volume consistently



You own output. We do not micromanage.





==================================================

WHAT YOU WILL OWN

==================================================



- A team of 5+ writers (your responsibility, not ours)

- Writer onboarding and replacement

- Daily and weekly content delivery

- Meeting monthly word targets

- Ensuring content is NOT AI-generated or generic



You will NOT:

- Write articles yourself

- Ask us to hire writers

- Ask us to manage day-to-day tasks





==================================================

CONTENT TYPE

==================================================



- Long-form articles (1,500–3,000 words)

- Practical, experience-based content

- Pain-killer content that removes confusion

- Not fluff, definitions, or AI-style writing



We provide:

- Detailed outlines

- Editorial direction

- Feedback from a senior editor





==================================================

REQUIREMENTS (MANDATORY)

==================================================



You MUST meet ALL of the following:

- Currently or previously managed at least 5 writers

- Delivered 200,000+ words per month before

- Understand how to enforce quality at scale

- Can replace writers quickly if quality drops

- Comfortable owning delivery end-to-end

- Want a long-term role (6–12 months minimum)



If you cannot meet ALL of the above, do NOT apply.





==================================================

COMPENSATION

==================================================



- Fixed monthly pay (not per article or per word)

- Stable, long-term engagement



Compensation depends on demonstrated capacity and quality. You are expected to manage writer payments within your own structure.





==================================================

TRIAL / VALIDATION

==================================================



Before full onboarding:

- Short paid pilot

- Small batch of articles

- Quality reviewed by our editor



If quality and delivery are strong, we scale immediately.





==================================================

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS (IMPORTANT)

==================================================



To apply, reply with ALL of the following:



1. How many writers do you currently manage?

2. What niches have your teams written in?

3. Maximum monthly word volume you can reliably deliver

4. How you ensure writers do NOT use AI

5. One example of content your team produced (editor-approved)



Applications that do not answer ALL 5 questions will be rejected without response.





==================================================

FINAL NOTE

==================================================



This role is for someone who wants to OWN a system, not do tasks. If you are looking for stability, long-term work, and responsibility, this will be a good fit.

title: On-Camera YouTube Video Creator (How-To Videos)
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE



We produce short educational videos explaining U.S. business topics such as LLC basics, EIN steps, BOI rules, and state-specific guides.

This is a full-time, high-volume role focused on repeatable, script-based production.

You will present calmly on camera using scripts provided by our team and deliver fully edited, upload-ready videos.



MUST-HAVE REQUIREMENTS | NON-NEGOTIABLE

-Comfortable speaking on camera

-Clear neutral American-style English

-Ability to explain topics calmly and clearly

-MUST submit a 1-minute video sample



PRODUCTION VOLUME | READ CAREFULLY



We publish at scale. Strong performers typically produce 40–60 finished videos per month.

Each video means:

-Recording

-Basic editing

-Final upload-ready file



This role suits people comfortable with:

-High-volume repeatable production

-Structured script-led content

-Consistency over creative reinvention



RESPONSIBILITIES

-Record educational videos from scripts

-Basic editing | cuts | cleanup | simple visuals if needed

-Deliver upload-ready final files

-Maintain consistent audio video and presentation quality

-Re-record short sections when required

-Record simple voice-overs for short clips



REQUIREMENTS

-Clear spoken English with good pacing

-Confident natural camera presence

-Reliable microphone and basic lighting

-Basic video editing capability

-Ability to follow scripts closely



COMPENSATION | WORK STRUCTURE

-$800 per month

-Full-time | 40 hours per week availability

-Long-term contract for the right fit

-Performance judged on output consistency and quality



HOW TO APPLY



Record a 60–90 second video explaining:

-What is an EIN?



Upload video | Drive | YouTube | Loom

Share past work if available

Use subject line:

-Video Producer | Your Name | Earliest Start



Applications without a video sample will NOT be reviewed.

title: Direct Link Seller – Business / Legal / Finance Niches
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE



We’re looking for experienced link sellers / publisher relations specialists who already have access to real business, legal, finance, and editorial websites and can place links directly.



This is NOT an outreach-from-scratch role.



If you already control publisher relationships or maintain private publisher inventories, this role is a strong fit.



We are specifically interested in people who:

• Have worked at SEO agencies or link vendors

• Maintain private lists of real publishers

• Can sell placements at pre-agreed price ceilings

• Understand risk in YMYL niches (legal, business, finance)



WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR



You should already have access to:

• Business / legal / finance blogs

• Editorial websites with real traffic

• News-style or authority publications

• Guest post friendly publishers

• Clean websites (no spam history)



We are NOT interested in:

• PBNs

• Link farms

• Casino, adult, or crypto-heavy sites

• Auto-approve guest post networks



OUR PRICING (TRANSPARENT)



We buy links directly at fixed price ceilings:



DR 45–50 ? up to $45

DR 50–55 ? up to $55

DR 55–60 ? up to $70

DR 60–65 ? up to $90



Details:

• Permanent dofollow contextual links

• Minimum link life: 3 years



We prioritize:

• Repeat monthly buying

• Bulk orders

• Long-term partnerships



HOW THIS WORKS



You share your site list (URLs, DR, traffic, niche).



We select the sites we want.



Orders are placed directly.



Payment is made per placement.



No guessing. No wasted outreach.



HOW TO APPLY



Please send:

• A list of sites you can place links on (Google Sheet preferred)

• DR, traffic, niche, and your price per site

• Your preferred payment method



Subject line:

Link Inventory Partner – Your Name
