title: Social Media Content Creator  + Operations Support ( Travel & Sports )
description:
Event Escapes is an AI-Powered Travel Startup based in Australia. We sell high-end travel packages for the world’s biggest events: Formula 1, Premier League, NBA, and Taylor Swift. etc.



We are looking for a Creative Producer who can take our travel packages and turn them into viral, high-converting content for Instagram Reels and TikTok plus handle VIP customer support and operations. 



HOURS: 20 Hours / Week (Flexible Schedule)

LOCATION: Remote (Work from Home) 

CAREER PATH: Potential to upgrade to Full-Time (40hrs/week) after a 4-month performance review.



YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES (60% Content / 40% Operations)



1. SOCIAL MEDIA & CONTENT (60% - The Growth Engine):



Video Production: You edit 3-5 high-quality Reels/TikToks per week. You are an expert in CapCut and know how to use trending audio, hooks, and fast-paced editing to grab attention.



Content Strategy: You research upcoming events (e.g., "Monaco GP 2026") and create a content calendar to promote them before they sell out.



Aesthetic & Brand: You use Canva to create professional Instagram Stories and Carousels that look like a premium luxury travel brand.



Community Growth: You reply to comments, engage with travel communities, and build hype around our brand.



2. OPERATIONS & SUPPORT (40% - The Safety Net):



Emergency Booking Support: You are the first line of defense for customers in trouble. If a guest has an issue at hotel check-in or with their tickets, you resolve it immediately via WhatsApp,
, or Live Chat.



VIP Concierge: We sell packages worth $5,000+. You manage our Support Inbox with flawless, professional, and empathetic English.



Flexible On-Call: You generally work weekdays, but we may need you to be on-call during major events to handle urgent questions if they arise.



MANDATORY TECH REQUIREMENTS:



Own Device: You must have your own fast Laptop or PC capable of editing video without lagging. (We do not provide equipment).



Internet: High-speed connection is required for uploading large video files and streaming sports.



Backup Plan: You must have a backup internet source (e.g., Mobile Data Hotspot) in case of outages.



WHO YOU ARE:



A Visual Storyteller: You have a portfolio of travel or lifestyle content that looks expensive and professional.



Tech-Savvy: You are comfortable using AI tools (ChatGPT/Claude), Admin Dashboards, and Google Sheets.



Sports/Event Knowledge: You know the difference between the NBA Finals and the Super Bowl.



? DO NOT APPLY IF:



You have no video editing portfolio.



You are afraid to speak up and solve problems.



You cannot handle a fast-paced startup environment.



HOW TO APPLY (Required)

We ignore generic applications. Please complete these 2 steps:



1. The Portfolio: Share a Google Drive link to 3 Short-Form Videos (Reels/TikToks) you have edited. (Travel or Sports content is a bonus).



2. The "Crisis" Test: A customer DMs us on Saturday night: "I arrived at the hotel but they can't find my booking! Help me immediately!"



Write your exact reply to the customer to calm them down and explain that you are checking the system.



Subject Line: "Content & Ops - [Your Name]"

title: Commercial Manager
description:
Commercial Manager

Vantage Group

Remote / Hybrid | Full-Time

Commercial Structuring, Pricing Strategy, Contract Architecture



About Vantage Group

Vantage Group is a facilities management execution platform built to bring structure, accountability, and operational control to interior and exterior services across complex property portfolios.

We work with owners, operators, and private real estate groups who are tired of:

Managing fragmented vendor networks

Chasing missed services and incomplete work

Lacking visibility and documentation

Escalating issues without enforcement authority

Overloading internal teams with coordination chaos

Vantage is not a property management company.

We are the operating and accountability infrastructure between ownership and execution.

We are building this company deliberately — with systems, economic discipline, and long-term enterprise value in mind.



The Opportunity

We are seeking a Commercial Manager to own the economic architecture and structural integrity of every deal entering the company.

- This is not a junior estimating role.

- This is not a bid compilation position.

- This is not a sales support function.

This role is responsible for protecting margin, structuring contracts correctly, defining SLAs, and ensuring that every portfolio we onboard is operationally executable and economically sound.

In a young, lean, high-growth platform, this position is foundational.



Role Mission

The Commercial Manager exists to ensure that:

- Every proposal is structurally clear

- Every contract reflects enforceable standards

- Every deal meets margin guardrails

- Every SLA is measurable and enforceable

- No bad revenue enters the company

- You are the economic filter and structural architect of Vantage Group.



Core Responsibilities

1. Proposal Development & Commercial Structuring

Translate client scope into structured service architecture

Build detailed proposals for:

Recurring contracted services

Emergency services

Capital projects

Ensure clarity between scope, SLA expectations, and vendor execution

Standardize proposal templates and continuously improve them

Maintain version control and document integrity



2. Pricing Strategy & Margin Protection

Apply margin framework (target 70–80% gross margin)

Validate that retainers cover baseline delivery costs

Analyze vendor pricing and normalize for comparison

Reject underpriced or structurally weak deals

Conduct sensitivity analysis on larger portfolios

Escalate misaligned deals to COO when required

You will have authority to stop deals that violate guardrails.



3. Contract Architecture

Draft and structure client agreements

Define:

Retainer structure

Margin participation terms

Emergency pricing framework

SLA enforcement language

Escalation authority

Ensure contracts align with operational reality

Maintain contract templates and structure documentation



4. SLA Design & Enforcement Framework

Define measurable SLAs for:

Response times

Completion times

Quality standards

Documentation requirements

Customize SLA structures by service category

Align SLAs with vendor capability and enforcement posture

Ensure SLA standards are installed before onboarding



5. Vendor Pricing & Commercial Review

Review vendor quotes for scope alignment

Identify pricing inconsistencies

Normalize pricing across markets

Apply margin before client presentation

Maintain vendor pricing database



6. Deal Handoff & Operational Alignment

Create structured deal summary package for Account Operations

Ensure AOM receives:

Final scope

SLA structure

Vendor coverage

Risk flags

Margin summary

Prevent incomplete handoffs

Participate in onboarding discussions when required



7. Emergency Pricing & Rapid Response Structuring

Apply margin to emergency quotes quickly

Validate scope and cost alignment

Build rapid-turn pricing templates

Protect margin under speed conditions



8. Continuous Commercial Optimization

Analyze pricing objections

Refine retainer models

Improve SLA structures

Provide feedback to leadership

Identify automation opportunities in pricing workflows



What Success Looks Like

You will know you are succeeding when:

- Deals move from proposal to execution with minimal confusion

- Margin guardrails are consistently met

- Few pricing exceptions are requested

- Scope disputes decrease

- Founders are no longer reviewing individual deal economics

- Operational friction decreases post-sale



What This Role Is Not

- Not a task processor

- Not a passive estimator

- Not a junior contract administrator

- Not a quote compiler

- Not a sales assistant

- This role requires judgment, economic awareness, and structural thinking.



Required Experience

We are looking for candidates with experience such as:

- Commercial estimating in facilities, construction, or multi-trade environments

- Contract management in property or service industries

- Pricing strategy for multi-site service organizations

- Facilities operations finance

- Commercial project management with economic oversight



You should have:

- 5+ years of experience in commercial estimating or contract structuring

- Experience pricing multi-location service portfolios

- Strong understanding of margin modeling

- Experience working with SLAs

- High attention to detail

- Strong written communication skills

- Comfort working in structured systems

- Experience in facilities management, construction, multi-trade services, or property operations is strongly preferred.

- Characteristics We Value

- Economically disciplined

- Process-driven

- Structured thinker

- Calm under pressure

- Clear communicator

 - Comfortable challenging weak scope

- High personal accountability

- Not emotionally attached to “closing deals”



Reporting Structure

- Reports to: General Manager

Works closely with:

- COO (economic oversight)

- Strategic Development Lead

- Vendor Network Development Manager

- Account Operations Manager



Growth Path

As Vantage scales, this role can evolve into:

- Director of Commercial Operations

- VP of Commercial Strategy

- Chief Commercial Officer

- We are building for scale. Strong operators grow with us.



Compensation

- Competitive salary based on experience ($850 - $1,100 per month)

- Performance alignment incentives

- Opportunity to grow with a high-upside platform

- Details will be discussed with qualified candidates.



Why Join Vantage

- You will help architect a platform from the ground up

- You will work within a disciplined, systems-first structure

- You will not operate in chaos

- You will not be micromanaged

- You will be evaluated objectively

- You will build something that scales

-This is not a corporate bureaucracy.

-This is a serious operating team building an institutional-quality platform.



How to Apply

Please submit:

Your resume

- A brief (3–5 minute) Loom video explaining:

     - Your relevant work experience 

     - why do you think you would be a good fit for the position?

     - What do you like to do outside of work? 



Candidates who demonstrate clarity, structure, and economic awareness will be prioritized.

title: Marketing Virtual Assistant
description:
EDP VA JOB POSTING 

Position: Marketing & CRM Operations Virtual Assistant (20 hrs/week)

Company: EDP Engineers & Inspectors

Location: Remote 

Status: Independent Contractor (Part-Time, Up to 20 hrs/week)

Please see Application instructions in the “How to Apply” section.  CANDIDATES WHO DO NOT COMPLETE ALL ITEMS BELOW WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED!



About EDP

EDP Engineers & Inspectors is a Texas-based MEPF (Mechanical, Electrical, Plumbing & Fire Protection) engineering firm supporting architects, general contractors, and design-build firms across Southeast Texas and the Texas Triangle. We deliver permit-ready engineered drawing sets that move efficiently through AHJ plan review and reduce risk for our clients.

We are scaling a modern client acquisition system using 
, LinkedIn, Blinq, and structured nurture funnels. We are hiring a process-oriented Virtual Assistant to support this growth by maintaining CRM cleanliness, posting content, and executing consistent nurture workflows.



Role Summary

The VA supports the marketing and CRM operations engine. This is an SOP-driven execution role. The VA ensures that new leads are correctly segmented, nurtured, tracked, and followed-up across 
 and LinkedIn. Leads will be provided via CSV, networking events (Blinq), and inbound channels.

The VA does not perform direct sales, closing, pricing, project management, invoicing, or engineering tasks.



Core Responsibilities 

1. Lead Intake & Segmentation (CSV ? 
)

? Import contact batches provided by management

? Tag by:

? Audience 

? Source 

? Funnel

? Region

? Assign CRM status 

? Add brief context notes 

2. CRM Nurture Execution (
)

? Monitor replies & inbox daily

? Update lead status per SOP:

? Cold ? Warm ? Opportunity

? Trigger nurture sequences and touchpoints

? Add short structured notes for pipeline clarity

? Escalate Warm/Opportunity leads to Executive for scoping



3. LinkedIn Management

? Send connection requests to Warm/Engaged leads

? Respond to basic inbound messages

? Conduct light role/company verification

? Log meaningful touchpoints into 



4. Content Posting & Engagement

? Draft and post 2–3 weekly LinkedIn posts (after approval)

? Use Canva for simple creatives

? Track basic metrics (likes/comments/impressions)

? Log into KPI sheet



5. Networking Lead Support (Blinq)

? After events, clean, categorize, and segment leads

? Assign funnels + statuses inside 

? Tag by event source 



6. Weekly Reporting (KPIs)

? Update CRM + LinkedIn KPI sheet

? Provide written weekly summary in Slack

? Surface Warm/Opportunity leads for Executive

? Monitor funnel health and response trends

? Confirm nurture automations are functioning



Execution Boundaries 

The VA works in:

? 

? LinkedIn

? Google Sheets/Docs

? Slack

? Canva



Success Measures / KPIs

Success in this role includes:

? Clean + accurate CRM data

? Consistent nurture cadence

? Cold ? Warm ? Opportunity progression visible

? LinkedIn posting cadence maintained

? Weekly reporting without reminders

? Clear communication in Slack

? Follow SOPs and improve reliability over time



Work Structure

? Up to 20 hours/week

? Flexible & asynchronous (majority of work can be self-scheduled)

? Weekly check-in (10–20 minutes)

? SOP + checklists provided

? Performance reviewed monthly



Required Skills

Must have:

? Strong written English

? Detail + process mindset

? CRM familiarity

? LinkedIn familiarity

? Canva familiarity (simple social assets)

? Google Sheets/Docs proficiency

? Reliability + consistency

? Professional communication tone



Nice to have:

? B2B marketing exposure

? AEC (Architecture/Engineering/Construction) familiarity

? Experience using 
 or similar CRM tools



Compensation

? Competitive hourly rate (based on region + experience)

? Paid contract structure with 90-day evaluation period

? Potential to expand responsibilities over time



!!! HOW TO APPLY!!!

Please submit the following in one
 inside this platform. 

CANDIDATES WHO DO NOT COMPLETE ALL ITEMS BELOW WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED!.

title: ClickFunnels Specialist
description:
Job Title: ClickFunnels Specialist (Part-Time, Potential for Full-Time)



Company: Great Carports



Location: Remote (Work from Anywhere)



Pay: $1,600 per month or $10 per hour at 40 hours per week



Schedule: 7pm-9pm EST Mon-Thu plus one 4-hour shift on the weekends.



Must be able to work the specified schedule for the first 6 months, after which you will transition to full-time and work Mon-Thu.



About Us:



Great Carports is a leading provider of metal and steel buildings, serving North and South Carolina. We specialize in custom carports, garages, agricultural buildings, and other steel structures, delivered and professionally installed. We are a rapidly growing company with a fun and dynamic team, committed to delivering quality and satisfaction to our customers. Join us on this exciting journey and grow your career with us!



Job Description:



We are looking for a creative and enthusiastic ClickFunnels Specialist to join our team on a part-time basis, with the potential to transition to a full-time role if it’s a good fit. This is an exciting opportunity to work remotely, make a significant impact on our business growth and online presence, and have fun while doing it! As a ClickFunnels Specialist at Great Carports, you will play a key role in developing, managing, and optimizing our sales funnels to drive traffic and conversions.



Responsibilities:



- Develop and implement ClickFunnels strategies to attract and convert potential customers.

- Create and optimize sales funnels, landing pages, and lead generation forms.

- Conduct A/B testing to identify high-performing funnel elements.

- Monitor and analyze funnel performance, making data-driven adjustments to improve results.

- Collaborate with the marketing team to align ClickFunnels campaigns with overall marketing goals.

- Optimize funnel pages for maximum conversion rates.

- Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in ClickFunnels and digital marketing.

- Participate in frequent live meetings, screen sharing, and video conferences.

- Be available to work the schedule of 7pm-9pm EST Mon-Thu plus one 4-hour shift on the weekends, including occasional nights and additional weekend hours, especially when getting started or when there is a big job to meet deadlines.

- Must be able to work the specified schedule for the first 6 months, after which you will transition to full-time and work Mon-Thu.



Qualifications:



- Proven experience as a ClickFunnels Specialist with a strong track record of success.

- Extensive knowledge of ClickFunnels and sales funnel optimization.

- Strong analytical skills and experience with digital marketing metrics.

- Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

- Ability to work independently and manage time effectively in a fast-paced environment.

- Must have a quiet place to work with reliable power and internet.

- Must have a good microphone and speak English very well.



What We Offer:



- Competitive pay: $1,600 per month or $10 per hour at 40 hours per week.

- Flexible work schedule, starting part-time with the potential for full-time employment.

- Opportunities for professional growth and development.

- A fun, creative, and collaborative work environment.

- Potential for full-time employment with benefits including health, dental, and vision insurance, paid time off, and holidays.

- An exciting journey with a growing company where your contributions make a real impact.



Do Not Apply If:



- You are unable to work the schedule of 7pm-9pm EST Mon-Thu plus one 4-hour shift on the weekends, including occasional nights and additional weekend hours.

- You do not have a quiet place to work with reliable power and internet.

- You do not have a good microphone and camera for frequent video conferences.

- You are not proficient in English.

- You cannot manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.



How to Apply:



If you are a passionate and skilled ClickFunnels Specialist looking to join a dynamic and fun team on a part-time basis, with the potential for full-time employment, we would love to hear from you! Please text your name and the position you are applying for to WhatsApp +1 (704)
. Also, include one of your favorite emojis and tell us why it is one of your favorites.



Great Carports is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: VFX / Visual Impact Editor - Lethal Luxury Short-Form Video
description:
VFX / Visual Impact Editor - Lethal Luxury Short-Form Video



Brand: Prismiera (Luxury Jewelry)

Pay: $1100 USD/month

Type: Full-time, 40 hours/week

Location: Remote (Philippines)

Software: Premiere Pro + After Effects (mandatory)



---



The Mission



Prismiera is a pre-launch luxury jewelry brand launching a short-form video series - 35–50 second stories about mythology, history, spies, poisoners, queens, alchemists, and other on-brand topics posted across TikTok, Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



The aesthetic is History and mythology meets high fashion. The editing energy leans closer to a perfectly-timed After Effects edit / storytelling than a corporate product video. (You have an eye for aesthetics and cinematography)



You will receive a script, a voiceover file, and a mood reference. Your job is to build the scene from nothing: generate AI visuals, voiceovers, source archival footage, layer sound design, and deliver a short where every second earns the next. A visual storyteller. (We provide access to the frontier generation models)



---



The Style



YES: Dark luxury. Museum. AE VFX edit. Stylish/Lethal. Fun. Rich textures. Clean typography. Controlled palette. Both silence and impact used with intention.



NO: CapCut default presets. Anything that looks like a stock photo slideshow or a corporate deck.



You understand that more effects does not necessarily mean better. Every cut has a reason.



---



Core Skills (Non-Negotiables)



Motion Graphics - You can build scenes, transitions, and visual elements from scratch in After Effects - not just cut footage.



Voiceover-First Storytelling - You are editing to a narration primarily, music track second. You know when to let a line breathe and when to accelerate. You never bury the script's punchline under a flashy transition. The voice leads - the visuals serve.



Retention Instinct - You understand that the first frame is an ad for the second frame. You know what stops a scroll. You build hooks visually, not just with text overlays. Every 2–3 seconds, something changes.



Rhythm & Beat-Sync - You can sync cuts, zooms, and effects to music. You understand "the drop." If you've made AMVs, fan/anime edits, or phonk edits, you already have this skill - we want you to apply it with restraint.



AI-Assisted Asset Creation - You are comfortable generating images and short clips using tools like Midjourney or Kling. (We usually move onto new tools as soon as they are released). You treat AI as a production tool, not a novelty. We provide all paid accounts - you bring the creative judgment.



---



Bonus Skills (Not Required, But We'll Notice)



- After Effects compositing - Mocha tracking, light matching (future projects will involve product placement in video scenes)

- Typography sense - fonts that feel intentional, never default

- Color grading - pushing AI output and footage into a consistent palette

- Sound design beyond music - layering SFX on movement, crafting risers and hits



---



Weekly Output



Ramp-up (first 2–3 weeks): 2–3 shorts as you learn the brand voice and pipeline.

Steady state: 4–5 shorts per week at the locked quality standard.



You will work from clear creative briefs with reference scripts, mood boards, and audio clips for most batches.



---



How to Apply



Do not send a generic cover letter.

Use 7 apply points or more when applying.



Subject line: Lethal Editor - [Your name]



Send the following (in this order):



1. The Story Test. Link to ONE short-form video you edited that includes voiceover or spoken dialogue. We need to see that you can pace visuals to a script.



2. The AE Style Test. Link to ONE video that shows your visual rhythm and editing craft - an AMV, fan edit, fashion reel, or anything where the editing itself is the skill. It doesn't need to be "dark" or "luxury." It needs to show us how you think about pacing and impact.



3. AI Experience (1 sentence). What is your experience level with generative AI tools (Midjourney, seedream, Kling, etc.)? If none, say so - we'll evaluate the rest of your application on its own merits.



4. Hardware. Your PC specs: CPU / GPU / RAM. Plus your internet upload speed.



5. Turnaround Estimate. How long does a 30–50 second high-quality short typically take you, start to finish?



6. The Rewrite. Rewrite this sentence to sound dark, powerful, and modern: "She is really cool and strong and she wins."



---



Paid Trial (Shortlisted Candidates)



Before any full-time commitment, we run a weekly paid trial. We provide real scripts and style references. You deliver 30–50 second shorts. Trial is compensated at $250 USD at the end of each week (after work). If it's a mutual fit after 30 days, we transition to $550 USD payments every 2 weeks (before work).



This protects both of us - you see whether the work fits your strengths, we see whether the output fits our brand.



---



What We Offer



- Paid accounts for all frontier AI tools; seedance2.0, seedream5.0, etc.

- Creative identity - you're building the visual identity of a brand from launch, not filling someone else's template

- Clear briefs - most, if not every batch comes with scripts, audio files, mood boards, and specific reference videos

- Direct feedback - specific, constructive notes on every edit.

- A brand worth building - Prismiera launches April 2026. A second AI native game/anime brand after that. You're not joining a machine. You're helping build one.

Experience using U.S. tax software (ProSeries experience is a plus).



This role requires someone detail-oriented who can work independently, meet deadlines, and handle a high volume of work during peak season. We move fast and expect accuracy.



Compensation will depend on experience. Please include:



Your resume.

A summary of your U.S. tax experience.

Your experience with QuickBooks Online and Desktop.

Your hourly rate expectation.

Your availability during U.S. tax season (including weekends).



We are looking to hire quickly and begin onboarding soon. If you are experienced and ready to work, apply today.

title: Social Media Coordinator
description:
About That Stay (ATS) is a boutique short-term rental management and marketing company based in Ontario, Canada.



We manage curated, design-forward vacation rentals including luxury cottages, lakehouses, and cabins. Our brand focuses on elevated positioning, strong storytelling, and premium guest experience.



We are growing quickly and looking for a creative, strategic, and detail-oriented Social Media Manager to take our social presence to the next level. This role is not just about posting content — it’s about building authority, trust, and brand recognition.



Your Role



You will manage and grow our social media presence across Instagram and
, with potential expansion into TikTok.

Your primary goal is to position ATS as a trusted, premium brand in vacation rental management and curated stays.



Responsibilities



- Create monthly content calendars aligned with brand strategy

- Develop content pillars such as owner education, guest inspiration, authority positioning, and behind-the-scenes

- Write strong, polished captions in a premium, confident tone

- Repurpose existing photo and video content into reels and carousels

- Edit short-form videos using tools such as CapCut or Canva

- Design clean, minimal graphics in Canva

- Research hashtags, and other techniques that support organic growth

- Engage with relevant accounts and support community building

- Track analytics and provide monthly performance reports

- Suggest improvements based on results



Required Skills



- Excellent written English (very important)

- Strong understanding of Instagram strategy

- Canva proficiency

- Basic video editing skills

- Organized and detail-oriented

- Able to follow brand guidelines

- Reliable internet connection and equipment



Bonus (Not Required but a Plus)



- Experience working with North American clients

- Experience with short-term rentals, hospitality, real estate, or luxury brands preferred



Personality We’re Looking For



Proactive and solution-oriented

Strategic thinker, not just task-based

Creative but structured

Professional and polished

Interested in a long-term role and growing with the company



We are looking for someone for part-time 8-10 hours a week or so.



To Apply



Please include:

A short introduction about yourself

Links to social accounts you have managed/Portfolio

2–3 sample captions you would write for a luxury cottage brand

Your resume

Your availability (hours per week)



Please note that HEAVY canva-focused portfolios won't really impress me. I am looking for people who have worked with high quality content, ideally in the travel industry. The industry the business falls in is luxury high-end, so any designs need to align with that.

title: ELITE VIDEO EDITOR WANTED FOR 7-FIGURE ECOMMERCE BRAND (AI + Direct Response)
description:
Hey there,



My team and I are looking for a highly skilled Video Editor to join our fast-growing 7-figure eCommerce brand.



We’ve built our success primarily on high-converting image ads, and now we’re transitioning aggressively into video ads.



We are looking for someone who can take our proven winning angles and transform them into powerful, emotional, direct-response video creatives.



This is not just a “cut clips together” role.



This is a key growth position inside the company.



We serve primarily older demographics (40–70 years old) in Western markets. Our ads focus on:



- Health concerns

- Dust, mold, allergies

- Home safety

- Long-term wellbeing

- Protection of family



This means:



- We do NOT need fast TikTok-style editing

- We need strong storytelling

- Clear messaging

- Emotional pacing

- Direct response structure



# ROLE



You are responsible for turning proven angles into high-converting video ads.



You ensure every video:



- Has a strong hook (first 3 seconds)

- Communicates a clear desire

- Uses direct response principles

- Is structured for performance marketing

- Matches our older target audience



You will work directly with the CEO and creative team.



# RESPONSIBILITIES



- Edit video ads for
 & Instagram

- Turn winning image concepts into video formats

- Use AI tools for visual generation when needed

- Generate new creative ideas and angles

- Improve scripts visually with pacing & structure

- Create multiple variations of ads for testing

- Contribute creative ideas during team discussions



# REQUIREMENTS



You MUST:



- Have experience editing direct-response video ads

- Understand basic direct response principles (hooks, problem-agitate-solution, UGC structure, testimonials, authority angles, etc.)

- Have experience with AI tools:

    - Higgsfield or similar image generation models (NanoBanana Pro is a big plus)

    - Video generation models like Veo3, Kling, or Sora 2

- Have a strong understanding of emotional pacing

- Be able to work independently

- Have a reliable laptop/computer setup

- Have fast and stable internet

- Be fluent in English



Big PLUS:



- Experience in health/home-related products

- Ability to suggest new concepts and creative angles

- Strong marketing intuition



# RESULTS WE EXPECT



- 3–5 high-quality video ads per week (depending on complexity)

- Constant improvement in structure and storytelling

- Contribution of new ideas to the creative team

- Proactive communication



# COMPENSATION STRUCTURE



- Starting at $10/hour

- 2-week paid trial period

- Performance bonuses based on winning ads

- Pay increases over time based on performance and reliability

- Possibility to move into part-time or full-time position after we build trust and consistent workflow



# IMPORTANT



When applying, please:

1. Send examples of your best video ads (preferably performance-based ads).

2. Tell us if you have experience with Higgsfield or other image generation models.

3. Tell us if you have experience with video generation models such as Veo3, Kling, or Sora 2.

4. Explain what you believe makes a video ad convert.

5. If you have read this whole job post, please include the word “AI” somewhere at the end of your application for additional points.



We are building a long-term team.



We want someone who wants to grow with us and contribute beyond just editing.



If you are creative, disciplined, and serious about performance marketing, this could become a strong long-term opportunity.



Looking forward to your application.



— Kacper Jegier

title: Lead Generation Specialist
description:
At Keswick Holdings, we are dedicated to creating affordable housing through the acquisition and transformation of mobile home and RV communities into safe, comfortable living spaces. We believe in aligning each person with work that matches their strengths and encouraging ongoing growth, self-awareness, and improvement. At Keswick Holdings, you’ll be part of a mission-driven team that values integrity, personal development, and meaningful impact. Whether you're building new systems, solving real housing challenges, or growing into your potential, your work here truly matters.



Who We Are and What We Are Looking For…

 Keswick Holdings is a small, close-knit team of dedicated professionals committed to doing meaningful work that changes lives. We are ambitious and always pushing to grow, both individually and as a company. To keep building on that 
ntum, we’re looking for a driven and resourceful Lead Generation Specialist to join our team. This role is key to helping us stay sharp, organized, and focused as we grow our mission of creating safe, affordable housing. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, love the challenge of turning cold leads into real opportunities, and want to be part of a team that values growth and ownership, we want to hear from you.



Role Description:

 The Lead Generation Specialist is responsible for identifying and engaging potential sellers, maintaining our CRM, and supporting daily outreach and operational tasks. This role is ideal for someone who is proactive, people-focused, and thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.



Key Responsibilities/Objectives:



- RV Ownership Research and Lead Identification: Use skip tracing tools and systems to locate and gather ownership information for RVs, identifying key decision-makers and potential leads.

- Outbound Sales and Lead Engagement: Conduct cold calls, send outreach
s, and follow up with leads to build interest and move prospects through the sales pipeline.

- CRM Management and Follow-Up: Maintain and organize leads within our CRM system (GoHighLevel), including tagging, tracking communication, and ensuring timely follow-ups.

- Administrative Coordination and Support: Assist with general administrative tasks including scheduling and posting pre-prepared content to social media





Who you are:

- Outgoing, emotionally intelligent, and a natural conversationalist

- A self-starter with strong initiative and resourcefulness

- Compassionate, with excellent tonality and rapport-building skills

- Open to feedback, adaptable, and eager to learn and grow

- Comfortable using AI tools and navigating changing environments

- Jack of all trades with a flexible, roll-up-your-sleeves mindset



Who you are not:

- Someone who is consistently negative and complains

- Someone who makes excuses

- Someone who is unable to be accountable for your results

- Someone who lacks emotional intelligence or is hypersensitive to feedback and rejection



Must-Have Qualifications:

- Proven experience as a Virtual Assistant (VA)

- At least 6 months of experience in cold calling or phone-based outreach

- Strong time management and organizational skills

- Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written



Nice-to-Have Qualifications:

- Experience using GoHighLevel as a CRM and workflow tool

- 2 or more years of experience in cold calling or outbound sales outreach

title: Engineer / Technical Operations Focus
description:
About Us

Horseshoe Housing supplies fully furnished apartments for short- and medium-term stays through Airbnb, VRBO, and related booking platforms. As we scale, we’re hiring a technically strong teammate to help manage platform operations, integrations, and data-driven optimization across our listings.

This role is ideal for engineers or technically trained professionals who enjoy working at the intersection of systems, data, and real-world operations.

Schedule

10 hours/day, 6 days/week (60 hours/week)



What You’ll Do

Platform & listing operations:

Manage and optimize listings across Airbnb, VRBO, and related channels, ensuring data consistency, pricing accuracy, availability, and performance.





Integrations & automation:

Work with APIs, channel managers, PMS tools, and internal systems to support listing synchronization, messaging workflows, pricing updates, and reporting pipelines.





Technical issue coordination:

Diagnose and coordinate resolution of platform-related issues (sync errors, calendar mismatches, pricing bugs, messaging failures) with internal teams and vendors.





Lead & guest communication:

 and call warm leads and current guests, using structured, professional communication when technical or operational issues arise.





Reporting & analytics:

Maintain revenue trackers, performance dashboards, KPIs, and end-of-month reports using Excel and other tools.







Ideal Background

We are not looking for prior Airbnb or hospitality experience.

This role is strongly suited for:

Engineers (software, systems, data, industrial, or similar)





Computer science or technical degree holders





Candidates comfortable thinking in workflows, systems, and edge cases





Requirements

Bachelor’s degree (Engineering, Computer Science, or similar preferred)





Strong understanding of APIs, data flows, and system integrations



Strong English (written & spoken)





Ability to troubleshoot technical issues methodically







What We Value

Systems thinking and structured problem-solving





Comfort working with imperfect tools and real-world constraints





Ability to document processes and improve them over time





Ownership mentality — identifying issues before they become problems





Clear technical and non-technical communication







Compensation & Growth

Rate: $850 USD / month





Long-term role with increased responsibility for high performers





Opportunity to take ownership of listing infrastructure, integrations, and automation workflows







What Helps You Succeed

Confidence communicating with internal teams and external platforms





Detail-oriented, process-driven mindset





Stable internet connection (200 Mbps+)





Fast learner with new tools, dashboards, and APIs







Interview Process

During the interview, you can expect:

English proficiency assessment





Behavioral interview







Discussion around systems thinking, workflows, and troubleshooting approach





???? If you’ve read this far, please include “bnb” in your subject line and at the end of your application write any experiences you have ever had with Airbnb weather that being you stayed at one before or a family member hosts airbnbs.

title: Elite Real Estate Marketing & Social Media Virtual Assistant (Content Strategy, Brand Growth, CRM & Client Experience)
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE



We are hiring a high-level Virtual Assistant to help grow and elevate a top-producing real estate brand in the Seattle / Pacific Northwest market.



This is not a basic posting role. We are looking for someone who can think strategically, bring creative ideas, and help scale a modern real estate brand that blends luxury, lifestyle, design, and relationship-driven business.



You should understand personal branding, know how to create engaging content, and help the agent stay visible, relevant, and differentiated in a crowded market.



If you bring ideas, think like a marketer, and want to help build a standout brand — this is for you.



WHAT WE’RE REALLY LOOKING FOR

 • Someone who doesn’t wait to be told what to post

 • Someone who studies what works and brings fresh ideas

 • Someone who can help content feel modern, elevated, and human

 • Someone who understands how to grow followers and engagement organically

 • Someone who wants to help build a recognizable personal brand

 • Bonus if you love trends, storytelling, or viral-style content



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES



1) Social Media Strategy & Growth

 • Own the monthly content calendar and content planning

 • Proactively suggest content ideas (not just execute instructions)

 • Identify trends that can be adapted to real estate + lifestyle

 • Plan content across Instagram,
, LinkedIn, and Google Business

 • Track engagement and refine strategy over time

 • Grow followers and visibility organically

2) Content Creation & Ideation

 • Brainstorm fresh, creative content ideas regularly

 • Help shape content themes such as:

 • Educational content

 • Behind-the-scenes 
nts

 • Market insights

 • Lifestyle and design content

 • Suggest strong hooks, captions, and formats that perform well

 • Help create content with viral potential (while staying on-brand)



3) Canva Design & Visual Brand

 • Create polished, modern graphics including:

 • Social posts and reel covers

 • Listing visuals

 • Market updates

 • Client events and campaigns

 • Maintain a clean, cohesive aesthetic

 • Organize and evolve brand templates over time



4) CRM & Relationship Systems

 • Maintain and organize CRM/database including:

 • Past clients

 • Sphere of influence

 • Leads and referrals

 • Vendors and partners

 • Tag contacts (birthdays, home anniversaries, client types)

 • Keep the database clean and actionable

 • Support relationship-based marketing systems



5) Client Experience & Reputation

 • Manage review requests after closings (Google, Zillow)

 • Track testimonials for marketing use

 • Support thoughtful client touch systems:

 • Birthday reminders

 • Outreach lists

 • Relationship-based follow-ups



6)
, Systems & Light Operations

 • Organize inbox and flag important messages

 • Draft simple templates when needed

 • Help protect the agent’s time and focus

 • Support simple systems that improve consistency and organization



7) Website & Brand Presence

 • Help keep website current and aligned with brand

 • Ensure consistency across:

 • Website

 • Social platforms

 •
 branding

 • Marketing materials



IDEAL CANDIDATE

 • Strong experience in social media management including You Tube (real estate preferred)

 • Understands personal branding and content strategy

 • Brings ideas, not just execution

 • Comfortable suggesting new approaches

 • Strong Canva skills and a great design eye

 • Familiar with CRMs (Follow Up Boss, KVCore, etc.)

 • Highly organized and proactive

 • Excellent written communication

 • Understands relationship-driven businesses

 • Can balance creativity with professionalism



BIG BONUS IF YOU:

 • Love studying content trends

 • Have helped accounts grow significantly

 • Enjoy storytelling and brand building

 • Understand luxury or design-forward aesthetics

 • Have ideas for modern real estate marketing

 • Think like a content strategist, not just a VA



HOURS & OPPORTUNITY

 • Part-time to start with room to grow

 • Long-term opportunity for the right person

 • Flexible structure for a high-performer

 • Compensation based on experience and creativity

title: Webflow Website Designer
description:
Timeline: Must be available to start immediately and complete the project within 7–14 days



Compensation: Competitive, based on experience



***GENERAL OVERVIEW***

The Inspyre Group is a full-service marketing and public relations firm specializing in branding, strategy, and creative execution. We’re currently updating our company website and are looking for an experienced, design-forward Webflow expert to lead this short-term project.



This is not a junior role. We’re seeking a highly skilled individual who can bring a polished, modern, and strategic approach to both the visual design and user experience. You must have strong graphic design skills, a sharp eye for layout and UX, and the ability to translate a brand kit into a fully cohesive Webflow site.



???? Important note: While this is a short-term engagement, we frequently take on new web design projects for clients—often once or twice per month. If your work is competitively priced, professional, and aligned with our standards, this role could easily evolve into a long-term, ongoing relationship.



***PROJECT SCOPE***

- Refresh and redesign our existing Webflow website based on a newly refined brand identity.



- Apply our brand kit (logos, colors, typography, and photography) consistently and creatively across all pages.



- Build new pages and sections as needed, including About, Services, Contact, Blog, and Portfolio.



- Ensure mobile responsiveness and a clean, modern layout across all devices.



- Optimize the website for performance, load speed, and on-page SEO best practices.



- Build with client-friendly CMS functionality for easy internal updates.



- Work independently and efficiently within the project deadline.



***REQUIREMENTS***

- Expert-level Webflow experience — must provide examples of fully custom Webflow sites you've designed and developed.



- Strong graphic design skills and deep understanding of visual hierarchy and user experience.



- Ability to design directly from a brand guide with strong attention to consistency and detail.



- Must have strong SEO knowledge and experience implementing on-page SEO best practices during the build.



- Experience designing for different platforms and screen sizes with clean, responsive design.



- Must be able to communicate during US Eastern Time hours as needed.



- Comfortable working independently and delivering high-quality work on a tight deadline.



***HOW TO APPLY***

If you’re ready to jump in and can deliver professional work fast—we’d love to hear from you! Please
 
 with the following:



- A brief intro and confirmation that you're available to start immediately and complete the project within 7–14 days



- 3–5 examples of Webflow websites you’ve built (with links)



- Your resume or overview of experience



- Your project-based rate or hourly rate



- A quick overview of your SEO experience and how you approach on-page SEO during a site build



- A Loom walkthrough or screenshots of/links to your favorite Webflow project



- Let us know if you're interested in future ongoing freelance web design work with our agency

title: Social Media Content Strategist & Editor (Family and Insurance Law Firm)
description:
We’re building two high-energy law firm channels and need a creative content strategist who lives and breathes short-form video. You’ll pitch 2–3 scroll-stopping ideas per day, edit the videos we film, write captions/hashtags, and either deliver files for posting or publish directly (with account access). If you know what news cycles pop and can spot a trend before it peaks, let’s talk.

What you’ll do

• Own the content calendar: Plan 14–21 posts/week across TikTok, IG Reels, YouTube long form and YouTube Shorts.

• Pitch daily concepts: Hooks, on-screen text, shot lists, B-roll ideas, trending sounds.

• Edit for thumb-stop: Tight cuts, subtitles, beat-matched transitions; deliver vertical 9:16.

• Write to convert: Captions, hashtags, CTAs; optimize for search & saves.

• Post & optimize: Schedule/publish, pin comments, A/B test hooks/cover frames.

• Trend intelligence: Track weekly trends/sounds; adapt them to legal content.

• Measure & iterate: Report weekly on retention, watch time, saves, shares, and growth; propose experiments.

You’re a fit if you have

• 2+ years creating and editing short-form video for TikTok/IG/Shorts with proven growth wins.

• Strong editing chops in CapCut, Premiere Pro, or Final Cut; fast subtitling & cut-to-beat skills.

• Clear point of view on hooks, storytelling, and algorithm-friendly packaging.

• Research instincts: you can surface creative, unique content ideas and validate them with data.

• Process-driven reliability: organized files, consistent naming, templates, and deadlines.

Tools you use (or will)

CapCut/Premiere • TikTok Creative Center • Google Drive • Notion/Trello • Canva/Photoshop (thumbnails/covers) • Later/Buffer (scheduling)

Success looks like (first 90 days)

• Consistent output of 14–21 posts/week/brand with less than 2s hook intros.

• Average view duration trending upward; save/share rate improving weekly.

• At least 3 trend experiments/week; clear learnings documented.

• A repeatable content system (calendar, templates, asset library).

Work style

• Remote with America/New York time zone overlap for quick approvals.

• Contractor or part-time to start; path to expanded hours based on performance.

• Compensation: Competitive/DOE with performance incentives.

How to apply (please follow exactly)

1. Resume: Include relevant experience

2. Portfolio: Links to 3–5 TikTok/Reel edits you personally strategized + edited (call out your role).

3. Quick brief: 5 post ideas for “powerful but wearable rose scents” (titles + one-line hook + suggested sound).

4. Trend snapshot: 3 trending sounds you’d use this week and how you’d adapt them to relevant legal content.

5. Tools & availability: Your editing tools, typical turnaround time, and weekly hours available.

6. Rate: Hourly or monthly retainer preference.

If you’re equal parts creative director, editor, and trend detective—and you love the law —this is your playground.

title: Construction Estimator/Drafter
description:
We’re looking for a technically skilled and detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to join our team at Red Branch Outdoor Living. This full-time role is perfect for someone with experience in construction-related drawings, sales support, and CRM systems like Buildertrend. If you thrive in a fast-paced, highly organized environment and want to contribute to a company that builds dream backyards, this is your opportunity.



What You’ll Be Doing:

-Sales & Proposal Support – Assist our sales team by building estimates and proposals in Buildertrend with clarity and accuracy.

-2D/3D Project Drawings – Create and edit project drawings using SketchUp or similar tools for decks, pavilions, kitchens, and more.

-Engineering Coordination – Prepare conceptual drawings and coordinate with engineers to ensure compliance with local codes.

-Shop Drawing Development – Produce detailed build-ready shop drawings for construction crews to follow on-site.

-File & Documentation Management – Keep all drawings and documents properly named, organized, and accessible for the entire team.



What We’re Looking For:

-Strong Drafting Skills – Proficient in SketchUp (or similar), able to produce 3D concepts and accurate shop drawings.

-Construction Understanding – Familiar with how outdoor structures like decks and pavilions go together.

-Sales Process Supporter – Comfortable entering takeoffs, pricing, and scope items into a CRM (Buildertrend experience is a plus).

-Detail-Oriented & Organized – You’ll be handling project-critical drawings and proposals—precision matters.

-Collaborative Communicator – Able to work closely with salespeople, engineers, and field teams remotely.

-Permitting Awareness – Understanding how city codes and permitting might impact a project is a bonus.



Why Join Red Branch?

-Fully Remote – Work from anywhere while making an impact on custom outdoor living projects.

-High Impact Role – Your work directly helps us win clients and execute projects with excellence.

-Growth Opportunities – As our company grows, so can your responsibilities and compensation.

-Positive, Purpose-Driven Culture – We build beautiful spaces, but more importantly, we’re building something meaningful together.



If you’re ready to combine your technical skills, drawing talent, and construction know-how to support a growing team, we’d love to hear from you!



****Apply by submitting an application through the link below.*****

title: Appointmen setter/ISA
description:
Real Estate ISA / Appointment Setter 



We are looking for an experienced Real Estate ISA / Appointment Setter to join our growing real estate team. This role is ideal for someone who can jump right in and start calling immediately with minimal training.



Requirements

title: YouTube Operations Manager (Remote) — High Standards, High Output
description:
YouTube Operations Manager (Remote) — Systems, KPIs, SOPs, Team Management



Overview

We run multiple YouTube channels (faceless content). We’re looking for an Operational Manager who treats this like their own business (intrapreneur mindset), moves fast, and holds extremely high standards for anything he or she does.



This is not a “do what you’re told” role. You will be responsible for turning chaos into a machine: planning, execution, tracking, quality control, and team accountability.



What you’ll own

 • Manage the full production pipeline (topic ? script ? edit ? thumbnail ? upload ? QA)

 • Create and enforce SOPs (standard operating procedures) for every recurring process

 • Build and manage KPIs and reporting (weekly performance + production metrics)

 • Ensure deadlines are hit; chase deliverables; remove blockers fast

 • Quality control on outputs (scripts, edits, thumbnails, uploads)

 • Manage freelancers (editors, writers, thumbnail designers): feedback, performance, consistency

 • Keep everything organized in trackers (Notion/Sheets/Trello/ClickUp—your choice, if it works)



What we’re looking for

You are:

 • An intrapreneur: you think in systems, not tasks

 • A workaholic / high-output person (you enjoy building and grinding)

 • Someone who sets the highest standards and refuses to ship “average”

 • Extremely organized and proactive (you don’t wait to be told)

 • Comfortable confronting people on performance (respectful but direct)



Required skills

 • Experience managing workflows or teams (agency, content production, operations, project mgmt)

 • Strong understanding of:

 • SOPs and documentation

 • KPIs (production + performance)

 • Project management tools (Drive/Trello/Sheets)

 • Strong English communication (written + voice)

 • Reliable internet + availability for daily check-ins



Nice to have

 • YouTube automation / faceless channel experience

 • Experience with editors/writers/thumbnail teams

 • Understanding of CTR/AVD/Retention basics



Hours / Availability

 • Remote, long-term

 • Must be highly available and responsive

 • Daily updates required



Compensation

Compensation is determined on the value you bring. When starting off, we'll make sure you can make your ends meet. When (you make) the company grows, you'll salary will grow accordingly, or exponentially.



How to apply (important)

Start your application with: “OPS MACHINE” so we know you read this.



Then include:

 1. Your relevant experience + tools you’ve used (Notion, Sheets, Trello, etc.)

 2. A short example of a SOP you’ve made (or how you’d structure one)

 3. Your availability (hours/day + timezone)

 4. A brief description of how you manage underperformers on a team



Screening process

Shortlisted candidates will do:

 • Personality profile form

 • IQ test

 • Speed test

 • A short live interview + a practical operations scenario

title: Part-time Capcut / TikTok Editor
description:
Hiring for part-time work for a Capcut / TikTok editor with potential for more



You will be making TikTok videos using Capcut or the video editing software of your choice.  The editing process is fairly simple and straightforward.  Anyone who is proficient in video editing should have no problem with the basic tasks such as:

- Cutting dead space in talking head videos

- Adding overlay images on screen in the videos

- Minor effects such as dynamic zoom, cropping, etc.

- Producing b-roll content from voiceover and footage provided, having the ability to digest what is being said and pair up the     audio with corresponding footage



Please review a few examples of my content to ensure you are familiar and comfortable with the editing style:

1. Basic talking head - here you are mostly editing dead space and piecing clips together.


 



2. Talking head with overlays - same as before, but adding images and stickers provided to you on the screen to support what is being said in the video.





3. Faceless Content – similar to the previous examples, but focused on creating faceless clips of the product itself.





4. B-roll - you will be provided a voice over and need to work through the footage to find fitting visuals. A strong understanding of English and social media content is crucial here.


 



You will be working hand in hand with me on an extremely viral social media page and there is room for bonuses if deadlines are met and the content performs well!



Requirements:

- Attention to detail

- STRONG English

- Strong internet connection

- Previous experience with Capcut / TikTok / Instagram

- Good working with a team

- Ability to learn and take constructive feedback

- Availability to work 3-4hrs a day (with potential for more and increased salary)

- Able to work 6 days per week (can take days off whenever as long as mostly consistent)

- Can take payments through Wise

- PH or similar time zone



$350/month + bonuses for 3-4hrs a day MAX and potential full time work in the future with a salary increase.



To apply, please complete the recreate assignment below so I can see your skills (30min - 1hr max)



Below is a Google Drive with the original files you will need to re-create this reference video:



Reference video:  
 

Google drive: 
 



Please complete the following steps:

1. Download the files and import into your video editing software

2. Find the “good” takes of the video sections, put together to complete the video, and add overlays where it's necessary.

3. Pay close attention to detail in the selection of the clips, the pacing, cropping, overlays, etc.

4. Message me with a link to the re-created video

description:
Video Editor / Designer for Fast-Growing Jewelry eCommerce Brand

Company Info + Mission We're a fast-growing D2C jewelry eCommerce brand currently generating $250k/month in revenue, with the goal of scaling to $600k/month in 2026. We sell high-quality lifestyle and jewelry products to customers in the US, Canada, and Europe.



Our mission is simple: deliver great products and create even better customer experiences. We value positive energy, reliability, and treating both our customers and our team like family.



Specific Tasks We are looking for a creative Video Editor / Designer to handle our ad creatives. You will be responsible for editing high-performing eCommerce ads from raw footage, clear ad briefs, and existing B-roll.



Your responsibilities will include:

Video Editing & Production: Edit 2-3 video concepts every week. You must be able to turn existing B-roll footage into creative, cool, and converting ads.



AI Design & Editing: Utilize AI tools to enhance designs, streamline editing, and create unique visual assets.



Ad Optimization: Produce platform-native creatives that follow brand guidelines. You will review ad performance data and iterate on edits to improve results (retention, click-through rate, etc.).



Collaboration: Hop on calls with the team to discuss ad creatives, implement feedback, and proactively suggest improvements.



Requirements & Skills

Experience: 1+ years of experience editing direct-response eCommerce ads.

Visual Skills: Strong understanding of retention and pacing in short-form video ads, with a good eye for high-performing visuals, hooks, and structure. Experience designing in Figma is a plus.



AI Proficiency: Experience with AI design and editing tools is required.

Communication: Fluent written and spoken English.



Work Ethic: Ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and interpret performance metrics to drive creative decisions.

Tech: Reliable and stable internet connection.



What You Can Expect

Full-time position with a supportive international team.

Long-term position with growth opportunities.

Opportunity for pay increases as the business grows.

Regular feedback and a clear workflow structure.



Application Instructions

Please include the word "Apple" in the first sentence of your application so we know you read everything.

Portfolio: Send your portfolio along with your top 3 best-performing ads (video / static). [IMPORTANT - Google drive folder please]

In Flow Marketing is a results-driven

In 2025 alone, we generated:

• $2.5M in client revenue through Klaviyo

• 43% average open rates

, Instagram, and Threads.

• Develop and execute a growth strategy for
, Instagram, and Threads

You Are a Good Fit If:

Thank you so much!

Jess

* Adding captions, hooks, and simple transitions

* Repurposing long videos into short clips

* Creating Canva graphics for posts & presentations



Tools We Use: 



Experience with these (or similar) is essential:

* Canva

* CapCut (or similar video editing tools)

* Microsoft Office & Outlook

* Go High Level (or CRM systems)

* Social media schedulers

* Cloud storage & collaboration tools



Who This Role Is For:



You are:

* A senior operator who can think ahead and solve problems

* Proactive — you don’t wait to be told what to do

* Highly organised and detail focused

* Confident communicating in written English

* Comfortable working with a bold personal brand

* Able to work independently and manage priorities



This Role Is NOT for You If:



* You need constant supervision

* You miss details or deadlines

* You only want to follow instructions without thinking

* You are unavailable during UK hours



How to Apply:



To apply, please include:

*A short introduction about you

* Your experience as an Executive Assistant

* Links to social media content or videos you’ve edited

* Your hourly rate

* Your availability during UK hours



Start your application with the words: “Purple Power” so I know you’ve read this fully.



If you’re someone who thrives in a fast moving environment and wants to grow with a dynamic business  - I’d love to hear from you.



Bev

title: WordPress Technical SEO Specialist Needed (Rank Math + Schema + Core Web Vitals Fixes)
description:
Fix Structured Data, Canonicals, H1 Issues + Improve CWV Performance



Hi! My name is Rhett and I'm the  Marketing Manager at The Equine Practice Company -



I’m looking for an experienced Technical SEO Specialist to help fix several technical issues identified that we have with our website.



The Equine Practice Company - a continuing education platform for equine veterinarians worldwide.



Let me make this very clear before you apply.



- This is not a content role or keyword research role.

- This is a hands-on technical implementation project focused on:



- Structured data (Schema / JSON-LD)

- Entity linking (Organization ? Speakers)

- Canonical + redirect consistency

- Core Web Vitals performance improvements



This is a one-time technical SEO implementation project (I'm estimating 1–2 weeks). I'd prefer a fixed-price structure with clear milestones. If the work is done well, I may offer ongoing technical SEO support for future schema + performance needs to this website and our second website.



I want someone who can fix this properly and document the work clearly. 



A. Current Website Setup



To save time, here is our technical environment:



Website platform: WordPress

Theme: Kadence

SEO plugin: Rank Math

Hosting: WPX (Cloudflare available)

Canonical preference: I don’t mind www vs non-www - I just want one version enforced consistently



Key Tasks



1. Schema & Structured Data Implementation (High Priority) We currently have gaps in structured data, and we need a clean schema setup using best practices.



You will implement:



- Organization schema site-wide

- AboutPage schema

- ContactPage schema + ContactPoint

- Person schema for our “Meet the Speaker” pages

- Proper entity linking (Organization ? Website ? Speakers)



I want a hybrid approach:



- Rank Math for baseline schema

- Custom JSON-LD where needed (especially for Speaker Person schema)



Important: Avoid duplicate/conflicting schema output.



All schema must be validated using:



- Google Rich Results Test

- 
 Validator



2. Homepage SEO Fix (H1 Hierarchy) - Our homepage currently has two H1 tags, which causes structural confusion for Google.



You will:



- Fix the heading hierarchy (single clean H1)

- Keep design intact (Kadence blocks)



Suggested H1:



“The Equine Practice Company – Continuing Education for Equine Veterinarians”



3. Canonical + Domain Consistency (WWW vs Non-WWW) - We may have canonical duplication issues.



You will:



- Audit canonical tags across templates

- Enforce one preferred domain version via proper 301 redirects

- Ensure Rank Math canonicals match server/CDN redirects

- Confirm consistent indexing in Google Search Console



4. Core Web Vitals + Performance Improvements (CWV) - Because this is a membership-based site, performance matters.



I need help improving:



- LCP (Largest Contentful Paint)

- TTFB (Time to First Byte)

- INP / CLS issues if present



You will:



- Identify the top causes of poor CWV (mobile-first)

- Optimize heavy scripts/plugins where possible

- Recommend hosting/CDN improvements if needed



Retest using:



- PageSpeed Insights

- Lighthouse

- CrUX data



It is important that you document before/after results.



Most Importantly, The Final Deliverables (What You Must Provide)



At completion of this project for our website, I expect:



- Working JSON-LD schema for Organization, AboutPage, ContactPage, Person

- Clean entity graph 

- Validation proof (screenshots or links)

- Canonical + redirect mapping summary

- Before/after homepage H1 structure proof

- Core Web Vitals improvement report

- Clear documentation of everything changed



? Screening Questions (Required)



To apply for this task, please answer these:



1. What schema does Rank Math output by default, and how do you avoid duplication when adding custom Person schema?

2. Where would you enforce the canonical domain version (WordPress vs Cloudflare vs server)?

3. Share one example of Organization + Person JSON-LD you have implemented before (client details can be hidden).



Who Is My Ideal Candidate - I'm looking for someone with:



- Strong WordPress technical SEO experience

- Deep schema + JSON-LD knowledge (not just plugins)

- Experience with Rank Math + Kadence themes

- Understanding of Core Web Vitals (TTFB/LCP)

- Ability to work independently and document clearly



Timeline



I want this completed within 7–14 days, depending on scope and testing. If you are a real technical implementer (not just an SEO auditor), I’d love to work with you.



Please apply with your answers to the screening questions and provide me with a fix price to complete this project on our website.

title: Persuasive Copywriter
description:
We’re hiring a full-time Content Marketer to own our content strategy across platforms, with a primary focus on
 marketing (Klaviyo) and website (Shopify). This role is full-time and in-house (remote), so please only apply if you’re looking for a long-term permanent position. We're not hiring freelancer or agency.



This role is ideal for someone who is creative, strategic, and detail-oriented, and excited to work closely with designers to improve content performance through clear insights, testing, and audience-focused messaging.



What You’ll Be Responsible For

- Plan, write, and execute
 campaigns and automated flows in Klaviyo.

- Create and optimize website copy, landing pages, product descriptions, and other on-site content.

- Collaborate with graphic designers to produce visuals aligned with campaigns.

- Analyze
 and website performance metrics to identify what’s working, underperforming content, and opportunities for improvement.

- Participate in brainstorming sessions to improve content and campaign performance.

- Provide insights and recommendations to improve messaging, tone, and overall content effectiveness.

- Analyze website behavior and implement content-driven CRO strategies to improve conversions on landing pages, product pages, and key funnels.

- Monitor competitors’
s, websites, offers, and campaigns to identify gaps or opportunities in our market niche.

- Stay up-to-date with DTC content marketing trends and
 best practices.

- Providing administrative support, as and when needed to the manager.



Requirements

- Full-time, Monday–Friday (9am–5pm PH time)

- Remote position

- Strong writing, editing, and storytelling skills

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; able to interpret content performance data to make informed decisions

- Able to explain insights clearly to non-technical teammates

- Highly organized, self-directed, execution-focused, and able to work independently

- Willing to learn quickly and adapt as the business grows

- No prior content marketing experience required, but you must be sharp, creative, analytical, and able to learn fast



Nice To Have (but not required)

- Experience with Klaviyo or other
 marketing platforms

- Experience with Shopify or website analytics

- Experience in content marketing or CRO for DTC brands

- Familiarity with user behavior analytics, heatmaps, or funnel optimization

- Basic understanding of SEO and social media content strategy



What We Offer

- Competitive salary

- Performance-based bonuses

- Paid annual leave & public holidays

- Fully remote work

- Training, upskilling, and career growth opportunities

- A team that values ownership, clarity, and results



Application

Please send your application via
 to 
 with the subject line: "Persuasive Copywriter – (Your Name)". Include your OnlineJobsPH profile link and answers to the questions below in numbered format directly in the
 body:

1) Tell us about your most recent job. What did you mainly work on, what were some challenges you faced, and why did you d
 to leave?

2) If you’ve worked in
 marketing/copywriting, tell us about the campaigns you handled, tools you used, your process, and results. If you haven’t, what have you been learning on your own and how would you get competent quickly?

3) Share a time you took initiative or solved a problem in your workplace. It doesn’t have to be a formal leadership role, just something you’re proud of.

4) Please submit as much of your portfolio as possible. Submitting more work will help us make a more informed decision. Work can include anything within DTC e-commerce industry, but ideally aligned to the role you are applying for. If you don’t have DTC experience, submit your best work portfolio. Strong portfolios outside this role may be considered for other roles. 

5) Pick one project from the attached portfolio in question (4) that you are most proud of and answer the questions below. We want to see your ability to clearly explain what you did, your role, your reasoning, and the results of your work. You may optionally pick more than 1 project to highlight additional skills.

- What the project was

- Your specific contribution

- Why you approached it this way

- The results or impact (if any)



Keywords

creative copywriter, creative copywriting, DTC, CRM, SEO, copywriter, e-commerce copywriter, sales conversion, content writing, direct response copywriting, persuasive copywriting, performance ads, lifecycle marketing, retention marketing,
 copywriter, copy strategy, sales funnel, marketing strategist, copy strategist,
 strategist,
 specialist, copy specialist, sales copywriter, website copywriting, klaviyo, mailchimp, omnisend, performance marketing, postscript, SMS marketing, brand strategist, CRO, landing page, web copy,
 copywriting,
 marketing,
 lifecycle management,
 lifecycle strategy
